Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms in a great location”
Reviews.Author: worms
Reviews.Content: As long as you remember this is a city centre hotel, in a great location without a restaurant or bar I think you'll love it. Rooms are accurately represented by the photo's; so simple, minimalistic, clean and small. We were in room 107, slight disappointment with the bed as it turned out to be 2 singles pushed together but overall it was good. The room consisted of Mini bar, wardrobe, tea and coffee making facilities, desk/sideboard and 2 bedside tables. The bathroom had great water pressure, clean reasonably spacious bathroom with over bath shower modern facilities, shower gel/soap/lotion is provided along with a very very slow hair dryer. Breakfast is available for 11E which as i rarely eat first thing I felt to be overpriced so didn't bother but it looked perfectly acceptable if you are a breakfast eater, cheese, charcuterie, bread, croissants fruit and cereals. As you can expect for a centre location there was an element of noise, the is a church of the opposing corner...this means bells....over Easter there were lots of bells...but they don't last long. Catch the metro to st Michael/notre dame and it's a 5 minute walk along the seine to the hotel, there's a 8-8 a couple of bakers and other shops nearby, plenty of restaurants to pick from. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: MarkA93
Reviews.Content: Small hotel, just off Rue St Germain. Small rooms (12x12 ft), world's tiniest elevator ( hold your breath!),but adequate accommodations. The great thing is the location. In the heart of the Latin Quarter, the hotel is surrounded by small shops and tons of restaurants. It is a 3 minute walk to Metro, and a very easy walk to the Pantheon, the river, Notre Dame, Pompidou Center. You really can't find a better location. Paris has an easy metro system, so you'll be nowhere in no time.

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay”
Reviews.Author: MarieJM84
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in April. Rooms are immaculate and the staff are very friendly. A great location if you are wanting to see the major attractions. Rooms are small but not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant for a weekend in Paris”
Reviews.Author: loufizz
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend in Paris. This hotel was excellent. The welcome was warm and the staff very helpful. The room was small but perfectly formed! Towels, toilettries, hairdryer and mini bar that didn't cost the earth! The bed was comfortable and the room/bathroom was clean. Location: 2 minutes walk from Notre Dame and the Batobus stop. Restuarants and shops within easy walk. We opted for the 11euro breakfast whichwas well worth it. As much as you can each in a continental breakfast, withplenty of tea/coffee. The atmosphere was relaxed and lovelystartto the day. I really recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to explore Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: jay b Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a brilliant location, close to all the main sites and metro. The staff are friendly, more than happy to help. Our room was great, clean and very quiet. Next time we go back to Paris we would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Second visit - and not disapointed”
Reviews.Author: Jude085
Reviews.Content: The Agora has a great location in the Latin quarter and within walking distance of all the main sights. I stayed at this hotel 4 years ago and everything was exactly as I remembered - including the church bells and the bakery round the corner. Rooms are tiny and en suite even tinier but if you know what to expect in Paris then that's OK. As others have mentioned room got v hot and opening windows helped cool down but street noise etc means not possible to leave open through the night. The Brioche D'oree chain was good for a quick breakfast and cheapest we found. As others have said - be warned, Paris is NOT cheap

Reviews.Title: “Excellent position”
Reviews.Author: Ian C
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a long weekend in Paris at the Agora Hotel. The position is perfect just a short walk from Notre Dame and close to restaurants etc whilst being quiet. The rooms (we had 2) were a good size for Paris with excellent showers. They also had mini bars and safe. Both rooms were in good order with modern decorations. We had breakfast in the hotel each day - eat as much as you like. The staff were all friendly and helpful. We would use it again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: NancyDUB
Reviews.Content: We loving staying here, it was quaint, well decorated and perfectly located. The hotel was close to all the action but discounting the odd metro rumble the hotel was quiet enough to get a good nights sleep. The room was small but perfect for a quick weekend in Paris. It was great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value”
Reviews.Author: paulieuk
Reviews.Content: One of the nicest and friendliest check-in experiences ever received here at this small hotel that packs a punch a little above its official 3-star weight. The ground floor lobby is welcoming and comfortable, and the wifi is fast and free throughout. There's a luggage room, toilets and (windowless) breakfast room in the basement. The lift/elevator is tiny (one bulky person and one bulky bag is about your limit) but it works if you can't manage the stairs. The rooms are clean and tidy and, for a three-star Parisien hotel, have a good standard of facilities. They are not, as you might have come to expect, spacious as such. However, what you need is all here - a very comfortable bed, a clean and modern bathroom with nice complementary toiletries, a modern TV with international channels (including BBC World News), a fridge (not automated charging) and kettle with tea and coffee. We did have one of the higher room categories, so had a Juliette balcony overlooking the front of the hotel and the church across the junction. There was some noise leakage from nearby rooms (either adjacent or above) such as water pipes, and even though we were on the first floor, we could hear underground trains running too, whereas raffic noise wasn't so much of an issue. The location is very convenient - short walks to Notre Dame or The Pantheon, and connecting from CDG Airport is easy on the RER-B to Saint Michael-Notre Dame and an easy 8-10 minute walk from there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: Mark S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an easy walk to Notre Dame (& handy for Pompidou Centre and Louvre), 2 mins from the metro station and in the best neighbourhood for cafes, bars etc. Our room was small but very clean and modern. The staff were friendly, and forgiving of my terrible French (and spoke very good English when I couldn't cope). We didn't try the breakfast (extra charge), preferring to sample the many nearby cafes. We found the room too hot, despite turning-off the radiator completely, and had to open the window from time to time to cool down.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location ...”
Reviews.Author: cfc19
Reviews.Content: booked this hotel due to its great location , 5 minute walk to the river & Notre Dame and plenty of cafes in between ..., metro just around the corner ,and found all the public transport was close by and very efficient . Getting back to the hotel i can only echo what others have said , rooms spotlessly clean and very clean , reception staff very helpul and friendly , would have no hesitation in reccomending this hotel . As regards to Paris we had a great 3 days trying to cram as much in as possible , came home completely exhausted but loved every minute of it . One tip i would give is, if you arrive on the eurostar rather than use the metro, take the RER to St Michel notre dame as its only 2 stops ,and only a further 5 min walk to the hotel than the metro at maubert-mutualite ...

Reviews.Title: “Ideally located”
Reviews.Author: ChrisS49
Reviews.Content: Very easy access to Métro Maubert-Mutualité and the bus service towards Gare de Lyon, and an easy short walk to the Latin quarter and the left bank. The rooms are kept scrupulously clean. Reception staff are professional and were extremely helpful in assisting me to access their wifi. Once connected, the broadband worked well. Furnishings are in good condition with a bright and stylish bathroom. As often in Paris, the room was small, the lift tiny and although the hotel no doubt complies with local standards, I wouldn't like to be there in a fire. The signed fire exit from my room was down the main staircase that curves around the lift shaft. There didn't appear to be any other means of escape. 11 euros for a rather rudimentary breakfast buffet is a bit steep but there are plenty of atmospheric cafes within a couple of minutes walk for a coffee and croissant for less than half that price. I'll certainly try to stay there again on my next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: robodada
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel to stay in, not only the location of the hotel was great the staff was as well! they even set us up with tickets for a show that we wanted to see!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient and compact”
Reviews.Author: magentapurple
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for our honeymoon and the most affordable we found in the latin quarter. Easy to find and get to by train to Maubert-Mutaliate station and sights like Notre Dame. Staff are friendly particular the little lady who vaccums and makes breakfast for you in the little den down below. DOnt plan on bringing too much luggage as lift is tiny, and can fit 2 large bags and 1 person, or 2 people and 1 bag. Rooms are super tiny, but i think most paris hotels are like this. Air con was particular strong, maybe cos rooms were small and bed was comfortable. I hear there are aprtments in the latin quarter that can be rented short term. Will consider this or book at Agora again if heading to Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Place to Stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: conner909
Reviews.Content: Aside from the fact that all of Paris appears too pricey for what you get, this Hotel in the Latin Quarter is clean, conveniently located near Notre Dame and best of all has a friendly and very helpful staff. Having researched on-line many hotels for the past two years, I have not found one that has met our finicky or financial needs as well as this on!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Jessie051
Reviews.Content: Good hotel rooms comfortable and bathrooms a good size for Paris hotel. Staff very friendly and helpful. Very quiet at back overlooking small courtyard, church bells can be heard at front.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: Matti T
Reviews.Content: The staff greeted us with great English. Everything we asked was answered in polite manner. The room has its on minisafe, which is nice to have. Key can be obtained from the front desk. Our room opened to the street from the 3rd floor. It was smallish, but I think all hotel rooms in Paris are. The room was very clean, had facilities for instant coffee and tea. Bathtub was one of the reasons we chose Saint Germain and we werent disappointed. It was spacious and clean. The whole bathroom was very clean and nice. The view from the room was fun, we saw the church next door and all the churchgoers in the morning when the sermon began. On sunday there were school girls selling baked goods and coffee in front of the church. The Louvre and Notre Dame are easily accessible by walking or with the sub, if you feel like going underground. But then you'd just miss a lot. For longer journeys the subway is the way to go, its easy and fast. There are a lot of great restaurants near the hotel, some recommended by Tripadvisor and ViaMichelin service (check it out for good restaurants in Paris). And YOU MUST stop at Eric Keyser bakery about 20 meters from the hotel. It has the BEST freshly baked bread I have ever eaten. You can get your breakfest there by grabbing few sandwiches and pan au chocolats and just sitting down next to Notre Dame and checking out the parisian lifestyle.

Reviews.Title: “Cleanest Little Hotel ..........”
Reviews.Author: jambony
Reviews.Content: I really didnt know what to expect as the hotel was rated 3 stars and we almost always stay at 4+. I have been to many places in this small world but neer Paris. Most 4-5 star hotels were full or ridiculously priced at the time - it was 3 or no go. Well I had to go. Pleasently surprised when we got there. When we destination travel and not resorting.... we are always on the go and never take advantage of many of the hotel amenities its just bed, shower and change and go. Hotel is strageically located near Notre Dame and easy walk to Luxembourg Gardens . Since we like to walk and weather was fabulous we even strolled along the river to Eiffel Tower and Louvre. Friendly staff modern convinience with Old World charm..

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Daryle523
Reviews.Content: We were greeted by a very friendly staff member. Our room was very nice, clean, kettle for coffee or tea, free wifi. It was very quiet. They had breakfast, however, we chose to eat in the Eric Kayser and patteserie (bakery) around the corner. This hotel was perfectly located to walk everywhere, which we did. It is also close to the metro. Laundry facilities were very close. I would definitely go back as I was very satisfied....

Reviews.Title: “Stylish comfort”
Reviews.Author: akahwhite
Reviews.Content: Two blocks from the Metro and two blocks from the Seine, Hotel Agora St. Germain offered all that we needed for our stay in Paris - helpful staff, good breakfast buffet at a reasonable price, comfortable beds, a quiet room with a small balcony overlooking the street, refrigerator, coffee/tea in the room, and numerous cafes, restaurants and bakeries nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and brilliant location.”
Reviews.Author: SimonDingle
Reviews.Content: We chose Agora Saint Germain as our hotel for my wife's first weekend in Paris and will definitely stay here again. The hotel is brilliantly situated in the Latin Quarter around the corner from a metro station, weekend market and famous Eric Kayser bakery and patteserie. Rooms are small but clean, warm, quiet and very comfortable. Service is excellent and friendly staff are very knowledgeable about Paris - they also recommended a great pub for us to watch the Rugby World Cup final at, which France unfortunately lost =( The Latin Quarter is a vibrant and very central part of the city and this hotel is a gem in it. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: Lorena M
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel and it was really great. Specially the receptionist Rafi, who made our stay at the hotel very comfortable, he helped us a lot. We really hope to return to the hotel and see him again. The rooms where neat and spacious. The only problem was the bells from the church, the rest was great!

Reviews.Title: “YOU DESERVE BETTER - DON'T STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: JustsayingJoe
Reviews.Content: I'll make this easy to read: Don't stay here. My wife and I just stayed there for three nights this past weekend. Here are the reasons why I wouldn't stay here again. First, the (room) wall is so thin you can hear the next room’s casual conversations. Not laughing, not partying, not screaming. You can hear them talking in a normal, average conversation. I know Parisian hotels are small but this was bit too much. And yes, the rooms are very small. Second, there is a church right across the street. And the church bell rang early in the morning (sometime between 7 and 8 am). Every morning. My wife and I happened to find this charming, so we didn’t mind it. But, if you are the type that would be bothered by being woken up by a church bell that rings 67 times (I counted it once) for over a couple of minutes, every morning, then this AIN’T your hotel !!! Just for the sake of a select group of readers for whom this may be relevant, I feel I need to mention this even though it didn’t bother us that much. Third, the night custodians at the front desk ranged from “not helpful” to “shady.” The “not helpful one” -- one night, the room temperature was too cool, and the room thermometer did not work, so I asked for an extra blanket. He looked around the basement, and said, “we don’t have one.” I asked, “how could a hotel not have extra blankets?.” He shrugged his shoulders and walked away. The “shady one” – there was this smooth talking guy with a beard who was at the front desk on two of the nights we were there. (He had a lage mole smack on the front of his nose, so beware of this guy.) He kept trying to push various services on us, even to the point of our being uncomfortable refusing his offer. He tried to get us to go to a restaurant, giving us his card with his name on it, telling us to be sure to mention his name to the restaurant. He tried to get us to use a specific taxi company to go to the airport. We relented and used his taxi company, and it ended up costing us 15 euros more than the going rate. Shame on us, but we got tired of being harassed and had to get him off our back late at night. The management should fire this guy, but then it didn’t seem like there was any management in charge during the day. Never saw anyone seeming to be “in charge” of this establishment, and it showed. Fourth, this place must be near or above the subway. Yes, we could hear the subway cars from below and the room seems to shake at times. I couldn’t believe it, but I couldn’t figure out any other reason for such a noise. So, if I am wrong and there is no subway nearby, then there is something else nearby that makes noises like a subway at various times during the night and day. I’ll leave it to future readers to figure that part out. I know it wasn’t the elevator, b/c I checked that. Anyway, the noise was irritating. There are other reasons, but I’ll stop here. At the price range for this hotel, there are other hotels in the area that are much better. I found a few while I was walking around and checked the rates, and my suspicion was confirmed. I could have done much better at the price range this hotel was available. It’s too bad, because the location was pretty good for spending time in Notre Dame and the Sorbonne.

Reviews.Title: “Small but clean”
Reviews.Author: JessPerthAus
Reviews.Content: Nothing fancy here, room is small but tidy and clean. Elevator is tiny. Were glad we didn't book breakfast here because there are so many nice bakeries and patisseries on the streets, and the breakfast room looks like it's in a dungeon. Great location, close to Latin quarter where there are some nice places to eat, but far enough from the bustle. Overall the hotel room was small and I am a teeny person, but it was clean and a nice place to sleep at the end of a long day.

Reviews.Title: “paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: mumbles30
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Paris for 3 nights in late March and were pleased with the location of the hotel and the room. We took the RER B from the airport to the Notre Dame station and it was an easy walk even with luggage. We were able to walk to many sights and the metro was close enough to use to get to the sights like the Eifell Tower that were too far away to walk too. The only complaint we had was that there was only one outlet for charging electronics but it is vacation so we didn't really care. Also, for the ladies with flat irons, I had a European adaptable one but it did not work in this one outlet available. It worked for the rest of our trip in Italy so I am not sure why here but once again it was vacation so who really cares about that. We didn't buy breakfastat the hote; because there is a lovely coffee type shop a short walk away that has yummy croissants and crepes (recommend the nutella and banana one!). Hotel staff is extremely friendly and although we attempted to communicate in French they always spoke to us in English and could answer all questions. We would stay again if we are ever back in Paris! Tip to remember: memorize the Celsius to Fahrenheit conversion so that you know how to set the room temperature and know what the weather outside will be.

Reviews.Title: “will be back”
Reviews.Author: Sasha122156
Reviews.Content: Location is great, room size was reasonable (not bad for Paris), friendly staff, speaking good English, housekeeping was good. Elevator was tiny. Overall it was good and most likely we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “As good as expected”
Reviews.Author: watakeet
Reviews.Content: Loved the location as it's just a stone's throw away from St Germain, Mouffetard market, pantheon, Notre dame, etc. Room is clean and nicely decorated. Bathroom is comparatively spacious and it even has a tub! Will come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely hotel, friendly service.”
Reviews.Author: AussieTripper100
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Agora St Germain for 5 nights and were delighted with our choice. The location is excellent, the rooms were very comfortable and well appointed. The bathrooms are very nice and spotlessly clean. While it is very well located, only a few minutes walk to the metro(Mauberte Mutualities) and about 7 mins walk to Notre Dome, it was very quiet. The staff were all very friendly and helpful and happy to make restaurant bookings etc which made things easier for us given our extremely to nonexistent French.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to our expectations”
Reviews.Author: Heidi R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel Aug 7-13. We had booked the hotel based on reviews here on Trip Advisor and were not disappointed. The hotel is conveniently located within a 5 minute walk to The Seine and Notre Damn. The staff speaks english and was very helpful with our questions. We had a room on the 5th floor, which I think is the best floor because the rooms have balconies you can sit out on. The rooms are small, but that was to be expected. We did not eat breakfast there, but regularly hit up the two bakeries that are within a block or two of the hotel. We felt that the hotel was a great value and would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “High quality room in a great Parisian neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: Leafsgirl77
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Agora for 3 nights in May 2011 as part of a big trip to Europe. Was with my best friend for these 3 days, and we had stayed in the Opera area during the earlier part of the week. We enjoyed the move over to the Agora as the Saint Germain area is a fabulous part of town to stay in with all the restaurants and proximity to the Museums. We stayed in a twin room, and while this was more expensive than our previous hotel (see my review for the Opera Cadet), the difference was worth it as the beds were exceptionally comfortable. The room was very modern and had a tv, a wall safe, and free wifi. The bathroom was really large and they had lovely products to use. Only a few downsides that are relatively minor - this hotel has the smallest elevator you've ever seen. Breakfast was not included, but we much preferred going out to the nearby cafes anyway.The wifi, although free, required you to enter your password every single time which was a bit annoying. And one of the staff members neglected to give me my wake-up call, but it was exceptionally early. He redeemed himself by making sure my taxi to the airport was prompt. If you're there on a weekend, be sure to check out the markets on Saturday just nearby - fabulous produce, flowers and foodie delights. Also nearby via a short bus trip, the Catacombs, which were super interesting.

Reviews.Title: “Well-run hotel in a perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: joethechef
Reviews.Content: No complaints here except a slightly aggressive night clerk who was trying to shill for local restaurants and the airport shuttle (that he presumably got a kickback from). But we ignored him and found our own way. Day concierges Eric and Aline were very helpful, friendly and competent. Location is, as every other tourist notes, perfect. Great bakery (Eric Kayser), restos. and everything else you need within 5 minutes' walk. Comfy beds, good a/c, reliable free WiFi. Reasonable rates, especially if you stay 3 nights or more.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with great location but very small room!”
Reviews.Author: happiest_girl_carla
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at Agora Saint Germain during a weekend in June 2011. The staff is okay and polite. The rooms are perfectly clean with fine and not very old furniture. But our room was really really small. Basically, the double bed occupied most of it. This is typical for Paris hotels but for that price I guess rooms could be more spacious. And location is great - on the left bank of the Seine close to Notre-Dame and Saint-Germain.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Empress_Holly
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for four nights in Paris. The room was simple but modern and clean, and the bathroom was a nice size with a bathtub. The location was perfect -- close to Notre Dame, multiple restaurants and shops, and two laundromats. Our room overlooked the church of Saint-Nicolas-du-Chardonne t, and we woke up to the beautiful sound of church bells each morning at 8 a.m. We used the computer with internet access in the lobby, and I believe they also had wireless. The hotel is next to a youth center, but we did not have any problem with noise. There was also a small elevator. No need for the hotel breakfast since there are several delicious bakeries, cafes and creperies nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Live like a Parisian”
Reviews.Author: Kate101_10
Reviews.Content: During our trip to Europe we were lucky enough to stumble on this hotel through our research prior to leaving. Although it was rated as a three star hotel it was situated where we wanted to stay in the Latin Quarter and the reviews on trip advisor were quite positive about it. Well once we got there we were overjoyed It was everything and more. Now for you cynics out there who like big rooms and pools and 5 star all the way go and stay somewhere else. For those who really want a geniune feel for the Paris lifestyle this is the place to be. the lift is tiny three people max but who cares it made for interesting trips up and down Rooms were small there aint no denying it but very comfortable clean and with everything you want in a hotel room even a safe. Why would you want to spend majority of your time in a hotel room while in Paris come on people! The staff were fabulous and helped us out with everything that we asked of them brekkie was definitely European but fabulous. If you wanted a lovely cafe scene you had a choice within walking distance actually we loved the little cafe just across the road so do the locals. Beautiful old church with bells walking you up but we didnt care because it got us up and out into a wonderful city. The Rue Mouffetard one of the oldest streets in Paris, boasts both a lively marketplace and wonderful restaurants that we went to for three nights and tried three different restaurants. There is a marketplace just around the corner where you could buy fresh produce, trinkets antiques and only 10-15mins away is some of the iconic marvels in Paris noteably Notre Dame what a magnicent building and the pantheon just head the opposite direction. I would and will go back there again it was close to everything we wanted and for someone who hates walking everything was close by. I loved this hotel and although rated 3 star I would give it 5 just for the experience Give it a go.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, great location”
Reviews.Author: osudd
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Agora Saint Germain the first week of July. The rooms at this hotel are VERY clean but are indeed a bit small. Regardless, Agora Saint Germain is a great value due to the cleanliness, the amazing location and the wonderful staff. The hotel is about a 7 minute walk to the Notre Dame and a 5 min walk to the heart of the Latin Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Not for us”
Reviews.Author: lbgirl16
Reviews.Content: Selected this hotel based on TripAdvisor, but was unable to stay more than one night because it was just not quiet. We could hear the people in the next room unzip their suitcase. The church across the street had very loud bells and you could hear the Metro running...and it runs frequently. The staff was very nice and helpful, and the location is wonderfully close to Notre Dame, but this is certainly not a place to arrive after a trans-Atlantic flight and you are jet-lagged.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: jtat99
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideal for younger travelers who don't plan to spend any time in their hotel. The location is hard to beat with several landmarks within a 10 minute walk, several restaurants and cafes nearby and close to a couple of Metro stations. The room was so small we could barely navigate around the bed. The bathroom was fine but we couldn't even open the bathroom door all of the way because it hit the bed. The hallways were very narrow and if you are walking up or down the stairs, you better hope no one is coming in the other direction because you won't fit. I agree with the other reviewers, it's great for the location but not much else.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and well-located”
Reviews.Author: KateJW
Reviews.Content: My 21-year-old daugher and I stayed the the Hotel Agora Saint Germain at the beginning of June for 8 days. Our room had two twin beds, close together, as we had requested, and yes it was smaller than North American hotels, but it was perfectly adequate for our needs, spotlessly clean, and had plenty of strorage space for our clothing. Cleanliness is more important to me than room size, and it was a delight to come home each evening to the cleanest hotel washroom I have ever used, including washrooms in much grander hotels. The location was excellent for us - we were able to walk to the Musee D'Orsay, Louvre, Pompidou etc., and there were plenty of restaurants and markets nearby. Notre Dame and the river were a very short walk from the hotel and Eric Kayser Boulangerie was steps away and we had breakfast there every day except our last day, when we had breakfast at the hotel. Although it was in the basement and not quite like sitting on Rue Monge with our coffees and tartines, it was a good value and quite fresh. The day manager, Eric, was a true gentleman and was always very friendly and helpful. I would stay at this property again - the only thing I would do differently would be to NOT take the airport shuttle to the aiport when leaving. He was late picking us up and he drove erratically and then told me I should have booked an earlier time, even though we had provided our flight time. I took a cab from the airport to the hotel on arrival, and that was a much better experience. Other than that, we had a wonderful vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great platform to explore Paris - Would definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: Chris_S87
Reviews.Content: I booked the Agora St Germain on a recommendation from a relative - We were not disappointed! Often travellers are forced to sacrifice quality in search of a central location - Here the two were combined. Upon arrival we were given a room on the 6th floor with a room overlooking the Church opposite - A lovely view. Initially the room was very hot as Paris was experiencing something of a 'heatwave' around Easter. The air conditioning had been deactivated over the winter months and was not functional for our first evening in the hotel. This made things quite stuffy even with the window left open which exposed us to some late night revellers heading home around 3am. After a hectic day at Disneyland we craved a good nights sleep and when we returned to the hotel we were told that the AC issue had been rectified - We could barely contain our excitement when we felt a chilled rush of air as we opened our room! With the window closed and AC operational we had a great nights sleep every night for the rest of our stay. The various members of staff were always happy to help. Every evening they booked restaurants on our behalf to avoid any language barriers we may encounter. Even when disaster struck and passports and cash got stuck in a safe the staff were extremely helpful. Despite the fact that it was Good Friday when the key to the safe broke inside the lock - All contents were recovered by Saturday evening. We did not have the breakfast offered by the hotel as we found a (very good) bakery 30 seconds away on the road to the station. Centrally located and a perfect platform to see the wonderful city of Paris! Would have no hesitation returning to Agora St Germain on our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DavidHerreraP
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a couple of nights in this hotel, which we booked the same day we arrived (we had trouble with another booking we had made). It has an excellent location, being steps away from the Blvd. St. Germain, in which we could always find a boulangerie, a restaurant, a bar, and some blocks away from Notre Dame and a metro station. The rooms were very nice and comfortable and the manager Erick was very kind and helpful. Definitely worthed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!! Great value!”
Reviews.Author: DengyD
Reviews.Content: Paris is my favorite place on Earth, so I use every opportunity to go there and in order not to loose any time I like to stay in the city centre. I stayed in Agora St Germain for 5 days (4 nights) in April with my best friend. This hotel is 100m from Boulevard St Germain and 500 m away from Notre Dame/ Ille de la cite/ Ille St Louis. It is on a quiet street and just around the corner there is the Latin Quarter that I just love. Pantheon, Sorbone, Luxemburg Garden are in neighbourhood. Metro station is like 1-2 min from the hotel which means you can reach any part of the city in not more that 25 min. So, location: just great! It is a 3 star hotel, but value you get is trully satisfying. I was not disapointed in any part of my stay. Rooms are really small, but it is the case in most big cities in Europe, so I expected it. We had a nice view over the street and church (there were no balcony, but a tall window with a french balcony). Be aware that there is a church just across the street, so around 8-9 you can hear bells, but I did not mind, actually they contributed to the spirit of the city :-) We did not use the hotel restaurant as you have boulangeries (bakeries) and restaurants with fantastic french food on every single corner in the city (and in neighbourhod), so it would be a real pitty to eat inside the hotel (and the breakfast is 11 euros in the hotel which is stupid to pay). There is a tiny market near the hotel (just in front of the metro station) where you can buy fresh fruits, cheese, pastries, wine and some genuine french specialties every morning/ day. So it is a great way to be Parisienne in few days :-)) Just grab a bottle of wine, baguette, some cheese and strawberries and head to Montmartre to enjoy in the sun on the grass in front of Sacre Coeur. The service in the hotel was really on a good level: the hotel staff was very helpful and we got some good advices from them, they were very pleasant and hospitable. Do not expect that housekeeping staff speak English, but at the reception they talk just fine. Internet services: wireless is free of charge and the connection was very good at all times (during 4 days). The check out is at noon. But in order to use the whole day in the city, on our last day we emptied our room early in the morning and when we asked where to store our luggage, we were told that we could put our luggage in a room in the basement, near the restaurant. It was strange as that room was not locked or anything, but we were said that it was safe. I was little worried about our stuff, but everything was OK at the end, and overall I felt safe at all times in this hotel. The room was very clean, again small, but you do not spend much time in it any way. Bathroom very clean and nice (renewed), we had a bath thub with a shower. At the end, I recommend this hotel and I will probably come back as it really is the most reasonable choice when you go to visit a city and plan not to spend much time in the room. Key words: great location, clean, pleasant staff, small rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: AnneLQ
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel, friendly and helpful staff, lovely rooms and a very central location. This hotel was a great find, I will certainly stay again and would have no hesitation in recommending this to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Staff at Hotel Agora”
Reviews.Content: I have visited Paris several times and am acutely aware that hotels can make or break a vacation. Please let me recommend this hotel not only because it is perfectly located, but also because the staff is exemplary in every way. In particular, Aline who works at the front desk is a customer service "pro". She knows her business top to bottom and knows Paris completely. Her ability to ease me into my vacation if I am stressed or point me somewhere in town is incredible. If there is one reason I stay at the Agora, it her!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, I wouldnt stay again even if it was for free”
Reviews.Author: Carolina1961_11
Reviews.Content: The room was so tiny we couldn't move around, we had a first floor room looking nowhere and we couldn't notice whether it was day or night, an awful carpet which I disgust to step on. Located on Latin Quarter could say the only good thing was the location, breakfast I did not try it was served in a depressing basement.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay here again”
Reviews.Author: SydneySarah79
Reviews.Content: Arriving tired and hungry after a long flight from Sydney it was nice to be greeted with a smile and shown immediately to our room. It was small, which is to be expected in Paris, but clean with a comfy bed and tea making facilities. What a fantastic location! Walking distance to many of the sights and in a charming neighbourhood with lots of options for breakfast, and ease of access to the Metro. The only disappointment was on our last night when we returned from a long day of sightseeing to find that our room had only been half made up - the balcony door has been left open and towels had been taken but not replaced, consumables not replaced etc. The receptionist (who was not the same friendly and efficient man we had dealt with for the remainder of our stay) was not especially interested in our complaint but did manage to produce replacement towels. No more was heard about the matter. That small hiccup aside, I enjoyed using the Agora St Germain as a base for exploring Paris and would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Trip was wonderful but not the hotel”
Reviews.Author: WanRazak
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fine at first as the concierge was polite to me, i was given a twin bed but joined together and requested that i change it, it was done the next day. It felt so wrong sleeping with my wife in that way. Room was pretty small but i guess that is the standard size for contemporary style in Paris. Lifts could only fit 3 person maxed though it can be a squeeze. The one which i hate most was the way the other concierge worked. One of them booked the shuttle bus to airport wrongly by 1 hr which i was supposed to arrive at airport at 8.00am and the shuttle coming at 8.15am. While the other one was rude to raise his voice at my wife and me for not checking the tickets properly. Maybe it was not my fault entirely but you don't have to be rude with me. BTW the first concierge knew more than the rest.. Anyway i ended up losing my 16euros as a deposit and took a cab which is more cheaper that the shuttle bus which would have cost 34euros. Taxi cost 25 euros. add 1euro for tips.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Perthites-2
Reviews.Content: WE spent 5 nights at the Agora and found the reception staff very helpful. They assisted us with directions, tickets to shows, sightseeing passes and airport transfers. The rooms are small but the bed was comfortable and it was quiet as we had a room facing the central courtyard. The are no tea/coffe facilities in the room but there is a small bar fridge. The wifi was very good as well and we had no trouble with the reception in our room.

Reviews.Title: “A well-located, quiet hotel on the Left Bank”
Reviews.Author: Rollwright
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Agora St. Germain is in a quiet street just off the bustling Boulevard St Germain, and only a ten minute walk to Notre Dame. There was some initial confusion about our room but that was sorted out by the very helpful receptionist. The air conditioning worked silently as it was uncharacteristically very warm in Paris. Like most Parisian hotels our room was quite small, but faced onto a quiet courtyard with wide opening french windows. The best thing about the hotel is its position - close to many bistros and the river, and a fifteen minute walk to the Pantheon and other landmark destinations. The staff were helpful, spoke English, and could not have been nicer. There is a street market close by on Tuesdays and Wednesdays - delicious cheeses, meats and vegetables and a really excellent and relatively inexpensive bistro facing onto the market. Across the road from the hotel is the Cafe Victor which does excellent breakfasts and lunches and around the hotel are a number of useful shops. We will return again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: poppy463
Reviews.Content: Great hotel situated 5mins walk from Notre Dame and the Seine. The staff were very helpfull, nothing was to much trouble. The room was clean and the bathroom looked new. Its within easy reach of the Metro, shops and excellent restaurants. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Adorable hotel, perfect location in the Latin Quarter. Great Staff and Rooms.”
Reviews.Author: kathleen_warren
Reviews.Content: My cousin and I stayed at this hotel May 2011. The location is amazing- restaurants, shopping and cafes all around. Its location allows for a beautiful walk up the Seine (approx 4km) to get to the Eiffel Tour (able to stop at Notre Dame, Musee D'orsay, Louvre.. etc very easily along the way). Seine is short walk away. This hotel is closest to Notre Dame which is beautiful. The rooms are tiny but efficient. Elevator is very small (3 person max)- but its very cute. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Beds were firm but confortable.

Reviews.Title: “descent hotel, great location...DON'T USE THE SHUTTLE SERVICE!”
Reviews.Author: kim81682
Reviews.Content: So all and all, this hotel was descent. i wouldn't advise you not to use them. tiny room, very similar to the room i stayed in while in rome italy. bed was so-so. front desk did speak english. no huge complaints but no huge compliments either. it did the job. with that said, don't use the shuttle service. after 5 minutes of driving, their shuttle driver rudely kicked us out of the shuttle bus because we were going to ORLY airport not CG airport. he dropped us off at a random corner in paris and just kept saying "no good, taxi" over and over again. didn't give us our 18 euro deposit either. my mom and i were pretty scared because 1) there was no taxi stand in site 2) we had no idea where we were 3) we only had 30 euros in our pocket because all we owed the driver was 16. luckily, i nice parisian helped us and pointed us to where we needed to walk to find a taxi stand. the hotel did apologize and said they'd reimburse us. still, it was a very scary ordeal. the bakery thats 2 bakeries over is fantastic. its not a restaurant or a sit down place (with the exception of out door seating). definitely get some baked goods there.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, friendly staff, great location in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: CaseG
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Agora St. Germain for 3 nights in April. The rooms were quite small, though not unexpected for Paris, very clean and comfortable. I had room 106 and found it to be very quiet as well. The staff are great, I personally witnessed the front desk clerks speaking to guests in French, English, and Spanish. The location is unbeatable with the Notre Dame and Pantheon steps away and the Mutualite-maubert metro as well. Graeat value for money on a 3 night package!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and a great location .”
Reviews.Author: VickyO7
Reviews.Content: We had two twin rooms in this hotel and they were very clean and comfortable. They weren't roomy, but I don't think this is to be expected with a hotel in Paris at the price we paid. The bathroom was more than adequate with complimentary toiletries. The hotel is ideally suited for exploring the left bank and took us just 10 minutes to walk to Notre Dame and the Seine. We had breakfast in the Hotel and it was very nice, as much continental breakfast as you could eat for €11. All in all a great hotel in a convenient location, shame their prices went up this year or we would have come back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location... but don't expect to check in on time...”
Reviews.Author: MrsFletche
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a wonderful location, close to the bustling Saint-Germain, Saint-Michel and Latin Quarter areas. The room was small but comfortable and all amenities were provided. Public areas were clean and elegant. Our room faced Rue des Bernadins with a view of Saint-Nicholas church – the bells provided us with a charming but noisy wake-up call each morning! The gentleman on reception (daytime) was wonderfully polite and helpful. Be warned that the lift doesn’t hold any more than two people and a large suitcase! The only thing preventing me from given this hotel full marks was the debacle at check-in. We were unable to check in to our room until 2 hours after the recommended check-in time of 2pm, and despite receiving our key at 3.35pm, the room had still not been prepared for our arrival. This was our only complaint about our stay, but was extremely inconvenient. Despite this, we would definitely recommend this hotel to others, as the fantastic location more than made up for the inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “pleasure”
Reviews.Author: wcottawa
Reviews.Content: Great return trip to Paris. Very happy with our central location at hotel agora Saint Germain, great tips from Eric and Rafael (sp?). We found it very central--one block from the hop on/off bus (in front of 8 @ 8 on St. Germain) and within an hour of walking to almost all sights (Eiffel Tower we stopped off at and found our own way back). We just love that almost everywhere is accessible by foot if you have a central location. Love Paris and Agora St. Germain! Try L'Ecurie just up the hill toward the Pantheon--fun, great food and ambience!--and reasonably priced!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: gansonwheels
Reviews.Content: My second stay at this small well situated hotel in Paris. Rooms small but what do you expect - we can't afford the Ritz. Very clean with tea making facilities - not come across that before in France. Nice breakfast. Pleasant and helpful staff. 10 minutes walk to Notre Dame and reasonably priced restaurants nearby. Kaysers boulangerie round the corner is to die for! Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location..but,,,”
Reviews.Author: geordy
Reviews.Content: Yes the location is great and the beds very comfortable..love the duvet! However making no effort to speed up the 2PM check in time ..not so good. And when we returned at 1:55....the room still wasn't ready...told 15 minutes..it was 25! Arrived back one day at 4pm..room not made up yet despite sign "Please make up the room as soon as possible" on door since AM. One day a dirty scrap of towel..used as a "cleaning" rag? was left on desk. Drinking glasses not replaced. The hotel also charges a non-refundable booking fee of 5 or 6 euros...most other comparable hotels in the area do not. I think we'll pick one of those next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Does What it Says on the Tin!”
Reviews.Author: Keith-Clan
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for good quality, no frills and fuss accommodation in a very convenient place this could be for you. The room and bathroom are small but spotlessly clean and of quality (particularly the shower unit). The beds are comfortable and in our stay the place offered totally uninterrupted sleep. The lift only holds 3 but is modern and does the job efficiently. The staff are friendly and helpful. Just 5 minutes from the Metro, 10 to the Cluny, 15 to the Notre Dame, and both the Louvre and D'Orsay in about 30-40 mins walk along the Seine. This Hotel is close to the Sorbonne and offers a great choice of eating within easily walkable distances. Save on Hotel breakfast by popping into one of the Patisseries who offer warm from the oven pastries and good coffee (our preference was for one on Rue de Ecole opp side of the road from the Hotel Latin Quarter, left out of hotel, right onto Rue Monge and then bear left at the first major junction then 50yds down on your left. They have seating and will prepare a fresh sandwich for your lunch. Croissant and coffee 2.20 Euros ).

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Squals008
Reviews.Content: Hotel Agora Sainte Germain was a pleasant experience for my wife and I. We found the reviews we read to be quite accurate. The staff were very friendly and were more then willing to change our room after the first night. Our first room was small and faced 'the courtyard', we wanted a 'street view'...Nice, clean rooms. Bathroom was new and modern. Great location, also near a metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: KosmasP
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I had a wonderful stay at this hotel. The room was spacey, quiet, and perfectly clean, as was the bathroom. The hotel staff were very helpful and welcoming. The only minor drawback was that the the church across the street: the bells would wake us up too early every morning. I would definately recomend this hotel to anyone, and I would also like to add that the off-season prices are really low considering what this hotel offers.

Reviews.Title: “First Time Visit To Paris - Fantastic Stay At AGS”
Reviews.Author: iluvroadtrips
Reviews.Content: We recently made a short trip over Thanksgiving holiday to Paris and stayed at the Hotel Agora Saint Germain. This was our first visit to France and the location of this hotel made it an almost perfect trip(biting cold weather). Note: our stay was part of a vacation package reserved with Continental Airlines Vacations. During check-in we were greeted with a friendly and courteous gentleman. He explained all the basic features of the property and the services they provide. The lobby was clean, comfortable and had a modern look to it. The elevator was tiny and could fit maybe two persons without luggage or one person with one suitcase. However, our room was directly located above the lobby and we were able to take advantage of the spiral staircase. Just below the lobby are the WC, luggage room and breakfast room. The breakfast room was well lit, clean and set with several tables and their wares. The lady in charge of preparing breakfast was friendly and always refilling our coffee. The food was your basic continental menu including five types of cheeses and two types of thinly sliced sausages. The food was fresh and table/glasswares were quite clean. Note: the breakfast is an additional charge and is stated so on the menu board in the lobby. As stated earlier, our room was directly above the lobby with a view of the main entrance, a wood working shop and a church just across the street. Note: if you're planning to sleep in a bit on Sunday morning, it won't happen. Those bells are loud and will wake you up. Charming but loud. Not a problem for us during our stay. Our room had two twin beds put together in front of a writing desk, wall mounted flat screen tv, a stocked minifridge and a mirrored closet in the corner. On each side of the bed is a nightstand each with a lamp. Both the bed linens and carpet were clean. No dust bunnies or stains. The room itself had no smell. For us, always a good sign of a well kept property. The bathroom was well lit and of reasonable size. We had a bath tub with shower and were stocked with both bath and hand towels. Note: our tub did not have sliding doors and curtains, so the floor will get a little wet after a shower. There is a half glass panel separating the sink from the tub however. Overall, the room itself is small and thinly walled, but this was never a concern for us as were dead tired every night and slept quite soundly. The location of this hotel was fantastic. We were within walking distance of several cafes and bistros, several bakeries(including Eric Kayser!), a small outdoor market, a cheese shop, a fish monger, a butcher and too many others to name. There are several ATMs and a few banks just around the corner. A laundromat is just two blocks away. The Maubert Mutualite and Cardinal Lemoine Metro stations are just blocks away. And located right next to the Notre Dame is the RER station St. Michel. We were also pleased with all the shops and eating places located nearby the Sorbonne University. Especially, with all the book stores. Overall, we were quite happy with staff service, the property amenities and its location. We have plans to visit Paris again in 2012 and would not hesitate to stay there again. But our next visit will have to be during warmer temperatures.

Reviews.Title: “Modern room, close to metro.”
Reviews.Author: Kfizzo
Reviews.Content: Room was very nice and modern, although it was on the small side, but this seems the case in most major cities. The bed was comfortable, and the bathroom was modern and very clean. Each time you left the hotel you had to leave your room key at reception. I thought this was great, as you were never going to be disturbed by house keeping as they new if you were in the hotel or not. The hotel is only a 5 minute walk to Notre Dame. You can also walk along the canal and you are at the lourve in now time. But if it is to cold you are close to the metro, which is easy to use and you are able to get everywhere. Staff were friendly and answered all questions we asked.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the price!”
Reviews.Author: schwartz225
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took our first trip together outside of the U.S. and after spending four days in London, we took the train to Paris. After figuring out which metro to take to get to our hotel we walked a couple of blocks and saw the sign. The lobby is very clean, and when we walked in we were greeted by a very friendly gentlemen at the front desk. He gave us our key, and a password for the wireless internet, and showed us to our room on the second floor. The room was small but layed out well with a flat panel TV and a view of the courtyard below. The bathroom was also small but very pleasant with a very nice shower. We were a little unnerved by a damp odor in the room, but found once we turned on the Air conditioning that this smell went away. The bed was comfortable enough. We didn't try the breakfast since there are many bakeries and cafes a block away. We used Rick Steves 2007 Paris book and found cafes we liked in each arrondisemont we visited. Also, Notre Dame is four blocks from the hotel and is jawdropping in the daytime and at night. The Pantheon is also walking distance and for everything else the metro is not too far away. The location is simply great! I guess the one complaint I had was the one of the front desk guys told us about a shuttle to the airport for something like 34 euros. The guy was doing his best sales job to convince us that this was the best way to get back to the airport and he needed the money right away to hold our reservation for 5 days later. Well we finally agreed because I didnt want to carry our luggage up and down the metro station again. Our flight was leaving at 1 pm and he was telling us to do the shuttle that would pick us up at the hotel but no later than 8:40am. Well that seemed a little early to me but I said ok. So the day comes when we had to leave and the shuttle arrives at 820 am and the shuttle is crammed with people. We are sitting in the front seat, on the way to the airport, when the driver tells us we owe him another 8 euros to take us to terminal 3 because no one else was going there. I argued with the guy saying we had already paid, and he said that we had paid the hotel guy his money but still owed another 8 euros. Out of principle I told the driver there was no way we were paying. So he started muttering to himself, and kept driving and then dropped us off at the right terminal with two other couples. Anyway, maybe its better to find other transport back to the airport then what the hotel offers.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, centrally located, knowledgeable staff - excellent!”
Reviews.Author: pam6471
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights and besides the room being on the small side, the hotel is EXCELLENT. The bathrooms were impeccably clean, the staff was knowledgeable and extremely helpful. The location is central to all the sites (except the Eiffel Tower & Arc de Triomphe). I loved staying here and would absolutely come back with friends & family for my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: enkay813
Reviews.Content: I recently made my fourth visit to the Agora St. Germain since 1993. Quite simply, I love this hotel. The location is unbeatable, around the corner from the Blvd St. Germain, a few blocks from Ile de la Cite one way, and the lively university area the other way, in the midst of restaurants, shopping and sites in a neighborhood made for walking. The desk staff continues to be great, recommending excellent restaurants, making reservations, booking tours for us, and ensuring we'd have transportation to the airport despite an impending strike. The rooms, while small, are clean and comfortable and like the entire hotel, have been updated since my last visit. And, while it's not the outrageous value it was when I first stayed there, it still feels like a reasonable price for Paris and the hotel's virtues. It was a pleasure to drop back into the Agora St. Germain last week and discover that all the things that have made it "my" Paris hotel for many years are still the same.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: suzyq989
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Paris for 20th anniversay & stayed 9 nights at Agora. It was the perfect location for our stay. To me it was centrally located. We walked to every major sites in Paris except for the Eiffel & the Arc de Triomphe. Used the Batobus (water taxi) from the Notre Dame location to take in the sites &go to the Eiffel Tower. The hotel was not too far from restaurants, cafes, bakeries, etc. We also liked location it was not to touristy. I'll go back to Agora for our next stay in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent unpretentious little hotel”
Reviews.Author: citytravellover
Reviews.Content: A couple blocks from Notre Dame. The room was very quiet (the hotel is quietly tucked away in a side street) except for a nearby church's morning bell, which was actually useful to keep us from sleeping away our valuable time in Paris. Guests were mostly from English-speaking countries, and the staff spoke excellent English and were friendly and on the ball. Nice-sized and clean bathroom with shower/tub. Didn't try the internet, didn't have the breakfast b/c there were many great boulangeries nearby. As is the custom at Paris hotels, you leave the key at the desk when you go out for the desk. Returning at night, they were always very quick to give us our key. There was some mix-up in our case where they didn't have a room for us the first night but they had an equally nice room arranged for us at a v. nearby hotel at the same rate. Weird (to me as an American) that they arranged all this without contacting us, but we went with it and it worked out just fine, caused maybe a 5 minute delay in our plans.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: lamamandenicolas
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, super good location, nice and clean. Couldn't ask for better in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Central location - close to Notre Damn and subway”
Reviews.Author: Ganefam
Reviews.Content: A good hotel with friendly staff. Rooms are smallish but value for money. They are clean, tidy and modern making for a comfortable stay. Staff at reception are great! They speak fluent english and are very helpful. Hotel is located near the river and Notre Damn and is two blocks from the subway. A good range of restaurants are also close by. Check out the local patisserie around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, very clean, and reasonably priced with amenities of a more expensive hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Directeur0
Reviews.Content: Do you want a clean comfortable bed, private bath and shower, quality front desk service, free room wireless Internet, and an AC that keeps you very cool? Agora Saint Germain offers these items at a reasonable fee. It's not far from the metro but the bus line is closer and a more relaxing way to travel. (The metro tickets are good on the bus). The hotel offers free luggage storage in case you plan to travel outside of Paris. No problem getting back to the airport as there are many shuttle services you or the hotel can book. Location is near the Sorbonne, so there is somewhat of a university atmosphere in the adjacent neighborhood. There's an abundance of restaurants, cafes, and mini groceries. Fantastic around the corner pastry shops are convenient for not only sweets but also quick lunches, etc. In Paris before, I stayed in the St. Michel area, but this location is less "touristy" and more relaxed. I'd rather walk a little to the metro stop and enjoy the ambience of Paris instead of fighting the crowds the whole visit. Also, the staff speak excellent English which helps as my French isn't the best.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: ArBrewer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, both 23, spent 8 nights at this hotel and enjoyed our stay. We chose this hotel from this site's reviews. The hotel was very nice and clean. The staff was very friendly and all the front desk spoke quality english. Hotel maid does not mind "do not disturb" sign so put some clothes on if you sleep in because she will walk in. We either had some really quiet neighbors or the sound proofing is for real. No problem sleeping and that includes street traffic. We did stay on the sixth floor though so take that into account. We did not use the breakfast service because of the price but that was a personal choice. The hotel was in a really good location. grocery stores, atms and market all real close. Just around the block in fact. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. I have never had any problems with theft before but I thought I would mention that when we arrived early, we put our bags in an unlocked closet and nothing went missing. We loved this place and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “The location is perfect, but services and value...”
Reviews.Author: adrianaassis
Reviews.Content: Typical French hotel at Saint Germain, very well located, close to nice restaurants, interesting street stores and metro station. If you need Internet in your room be prepared to face issues because it never works and the front desk staff is not prepared to support you. And if you enjoy to be treated as a special customer this would not be a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it... Great Location, Modern and Updated”
Reviews.Author: carma223
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel can't be beat... a 3-minute walk to the nearest Metro station (Maubert-Mutualite) and a 5-minute walk to Notre Dame. There are many cafes within a short walking distance, as well as bakeries, shops, etc. The hotel is very clean, modern and comfortable. Most importantly for me (I'm a very light sleeper) was that the hotel was very QUIET! I didn't hear a peep from neighboring rooms, and no street noise (we were on the 6th floor, which was the top). The street that the hotel is situated on (rue de Bernardins) is a very quiet street, yet is pretty close to Blvd. Saint Germain for the conveniences. My sister and I booked a "twin" room which basically had 2 twin beds side-by-side. The rooms are definitely on the small side, but have everything you need, including a flat-screen TV mounted on the wall, mini-bar, small closet, and free wireless internet. There is also an elevator (tiny, but fine to use, especially for luggage). We requested a room with a shower, and the bathroom was very nice. The only complaint is there's no shelf or counter space in the bathrooms. (Minor complaint.) I would definitely stay at this hotel again. It had the intimate feel of a small boutique hotel in a great neighborhood, yet all the comforts I'd expect from a larger hotel.

Reviews.Title: “all within walking distance yet off the beaten track”
Reviews.Author: siggydog10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 years before and loved it and decided to stay here again on our return trip to Paris. It is in walking distance to the Louvre, Notre Dame, and the D'Orsay. There are some really good restaurants within walking distance. The room is comfortable and clean. The staff is very helpful. There is a frig and safe in the room. If we go back to Paris we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Nuwaterfordgirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights. The location is wonderful, receptionist is very helpful and the room was very clean. Very quick walk to the metro and excellent shops in the area. Price was also very decent compared to other hotels in the area. The hotel does request that you leave your room key with receptionist when leaving but we never had any problems doing this. There is also a small safe in the room to lock your passports/money. The rooms size is small but excellent if you are only planning to sleep and tour. I would recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to have as our Home Base while discovering Paris.”
Reviews.Author: Havingfuneveryday
Reviews.Content: There was a group of us staying at different hotels. We were fortunate to have chosen the Hotel Agora Saint Germain. I found this hotel by going through many reviews on Trip Advisor. From the very beginning, starting with a most pleasant, informative, and efficient email correspondence with Katrine with an online reservation made many months ago, several quick and informative email correspondences with Aline followed, and the help of Eric, our stay was a complete joy! There was another helpful gentleman at night. Sorry I couldn't remember his name. There was 3 adult women and we stayed in the only triple room they had. 1 queen and 1 single. They gave us plenty of towels when we asked and our room was very quiet in back, on the first floor. We could not hear any street noise and we were just steps away from busy streets. The location was perfect for us. Everything we wanted was within an easy walk even though it rained almost everyday. (Take an Umbrella) Great little food stands, open markets,restaurants, the famous Kaiser Bakery, metro, train, and of course the great sites such as Notre Dame were all less than 10 minutes away, etc. We asked for wake up calls and they were very accommodating and punctual about that. Everyday we were out the door and on our way after a helpful, informative, and pleasant review of directions with Aline. She was just fantastic!!! We did use the lobby one afternoon to relax and regroup with our friends. We did not have the continental breakfast that was served downstairs. I cannot comment on that. We did not use our room during the day. There was a desk, chair, and small minibar that we did use to keep a few things cold. That was great. There was a nice closet with side shelfs that allowed us to unpack and spread out our things. The bed was just right for me. No relaxing armchair in the room, so if you are requiring that, this isn't for you. We did not need heat, but did require the window to be open for fresh air and that was great for us, as it opened onto a private courtyard. By American standards it was a small room, but by European standards, I think it was fine and expected. The Bathroom was small, but modern, clean, and efficient with a hair dryer and amenities that we did use. For us the location and help of Aline made this especially enjoyable. The cons: NO INTERNET/computer!!! They sent us next door to the youth hostel which was better than nothing but a real pain,and that is my only real complaint. In this day and age and for the price, they should have internet/computer availability for guests to check email, confirm reservations, and look up information I believe. Also, we were not told that a large fee would be charged by the taxi driver whenever a hotel calls a Taxi for you. We needed one at a certain time for a train reservation. The 10 minute ride to the train station costs us 24 euros. The night before, a taxi driver had told us is should be about 10 euros.(To be honest, I don't know if the hotel realizes this, so if they did know, it would be nice if they told you up front that the Taxi charges more for that service.)

Reviews.Title: “Location was quite good, breakfast average, rooms small”
Reviews.Author: donnab50
Reviews.Content: I have only stayed in one hotel in Paris, this one, but it served us well. The room was very small, but clean and the location was two blocks from the Seine and Notre Dame. We were able to walk to Notre Dame to pick up the tour busses or down to the Seine to pick up the boat. We accidently went into the hotel next door, apparently a hostel, and were very relieved to find out we were in the wrong place. Staff was quite helpful, some more than others.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and modern little hotel with great service in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Choosy-Guy
Reviews.Content: I recommend the Agora Saint Germain to anyone interested in staying near the center of Paris. It's location is excellent; just a few blocks from the Seine, very close to scores of museums, historical sites and great little cafes. The service was excellent: friendly, patient and (thank goodness) English-speaking. They were attentive, but not pushy - the perfect mix for letting us experience the city on our own terms. When we did need assistance they were always there and provided anything we needed. Also, the continental breakfast they provided was fabulous! Our rooms were, well, a bit small by American standards (much as everything is in the center of Paris), but fully-equipped by those same standards (TV, refrigerator w/beverages, lock box, phone, closet, full bathroom w/tub/shower, large sink and toilet). Our rooms also had windows that opened, which was a great feature for letting in some fresh air and hearing some of the sounds of the city. The only downsides I can think of are noise and compactness. In the case of the former, closing the windows was enough to reduce the sounds from the Metro and businesses below to acceptable sleeping levels. In the case of the latter, avoid the microscopic 'lift' (elevator) and you'll barely notice. Neither of those concerns would cause me to look elsewhere for my next trip to Paris - I'll defenitely be staying at the Agora Saint Germain again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel centrally located in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Hollydayhi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights late April 10. Booked via hotels own website, and found it to be good value. The location is fabulous, close to Blvd St Germaine , and the directions from the airport were clear and it was easy to find. I think it took us about 30 minutes on the train and then literally 5 mins walk from the St Michel train station which brings you out directly opposite Notre Dame. We ate breakfast in local cafes, and on Tues morning there was a market in the square where we had our coffee and croissants - very Parisian! The room was modern and was spotlessly clean, although if I was looking for any downside, it was a little small. But this wasnt a problem and we had a lovely trip here.

Reviews.Title: “perfect home base in paris”
Reviews.Author: laurakevn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Agora for 4 nights and loved it. Granted, little time is spent in your hotel room in Paris.... but Agora served it's purpose well. The location is excellent and central - we walked absolutely everywhere - to the Eiffel Tower, down the Champs Elysee.. all along the Seine. Bring good walking shoes (and forget the high heels as the streets are cobblestone and treacherous)! There are some over-touristy areas nearby, but they are fun and easy to avoid if you wish. We ate at some wonderful restaurants in the area (La Maree Verte, Trumilou..) and every afternoon brought wine, baguette and cheese back to the room for a snack before napping and preparing for late dinner. Such a lovely stay. We didn't take the breakfast, but there were bakeries and cafes nearby to take out from and bring back to bed :) All in all a lovely stay. If we return to Paris, we may stay out of center as it is less expensive, but for a first time in Paris, Agora is absolutely perfect because you won't miss a sight! It is on the doorstep of everything and you will waste no time seeing it all and still having time to relax and reflect. Just a note, was a little noisy - could hear people in other rooms, and street noise was sometimes loud... but nothing too bothersome. Paris is a big city, so we expected this!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in a perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: Heather H
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, together with another couple, stayed at The Agora for 2 nights in early March, en route to skiing in the French Alps. It was more than adequate for our needs, with clean, comfortable and modern rooms (not huge obviously, but then one wasn't expecting them to be). The bathrooms particularly, were well appointed and modern and we enjoyed having a bath (not for tall people to lie down in, but great for me for a soak and I'm 5'7") as well as a shower in the bath. All the reception people we encountered (I think at least one gentleman was managing the hotel for the owner at the time) were extremely helpful, friendly and courteous. We didn't partake of the breakfast on offer as we wanted to "experience" coffee and croissants in a local boulangerie/cafe. As far as location is concerned, the Latin Quarter is great and the Agora was easily accessible. We arrived, with our luggage, via metro and didn't find the few blocks walk too much hassle. We also used the buses, which have stops just around the corner from the hotel entrance. Additionally, it was a great base to meander from and we quite happily wandered the few blocks down to the Seine and back for dinner one night at a lovely restaurant. We found the hotel to be good value too and would stay there again without question.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little hotel in the heart of Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: ATLTravelBug18
Reviews.Content: What a great, neighborhood hotel! The staff is friendly and well-spoken in English. The hotel is located on a quiet side street just off Saint Germain Blvd. It is a short walk to Notre Dame, the metro, and several cafes & restaurants. The room was larger than expected and very clean. Additionally, the bathroom had recently been renovated, and it was wonderful. It's a very quiet & pleasant sleeping environment. While not fancy, it is definitely a welcoming, comfortable hotel at very reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “a Paris gem”
Reviews.Author: propete
Reviews.Content: My husband & I made our first trip to Paris -spending a lovely 5 nights at the Agora St. Germain. Our vacation was a whirlwind of sightseeing by mainly "feet", which couldn't have been more convenient given the location of the hotel. It was a hot day in July when we arrived and to our misfortune our room's air conditioning unit was broken. We contacted the front desk and although no other rooms with a balcony & view were available, the gentleman made it up to us. The service at Agora St. Germain was friendly, professional and customer service oriented. There was never a language issue, even though our French is very limited. They spoke English very well and were helpful in recommending and reserving a table for us at Le Criee (a nearby seafood restaurant). We had breakfast every morning and we highly recommend it: Fresh croissants, breads, cereal, several kinds of cheeses, coffee, boiled eggs, yogurt, fruit, juices, milk, etc... If we could travel to Paris at a moments notice, we would surely stay at the Agora St. Germain again. Paris took us away! Merci beaucoup :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, perfectly satisfactory hotel, dont expect a bargain anywhere in Paris, if you find one let me know”
Reviews.Author: mtm77
Reviews.Content: I took my pregnant wife to Paris for a kind of all in one valentines, anniversary, 30th treat......what a tight erse eh killing 3 birds with one stone. To be honest, i dont mind being called that as Paris is one of the most extortionate places i have ever been - in fact - forget that, it is the most expensive place i have ever been. Having said that the place is fantastic and we loved it. If i went again i would just hang around the Latin Quarter and St Germain as its botiques and wee side streets have plenty to keep you interested. To sum the hotel up, dont expect it to be lavish. Its quite petit but is perfectly adequate as Paris is the draw not the hotel. Staff are friendly, hotel is very clean and quiet and in a fantastic location. no complaints and would stay again and recommend. SOME GENERAL PARIS TIPS We did the Bateux Bus (boat bus) from very near by and avoided getting fleeced by the opern top bus deal. For our few days there it was perfect, it takes in most sights if you get a day pass. Also, dont buy a All in ticket for the metro - buy a "carnet of 10" which is much cheaper and was fine for our 3 days for the bits away from the bateux bus tour.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded all expectations”
Reviews.Author: madbond009
Reviews.Content: Very central. Walking distance to many tourist spots. Surrounded by amenities. Very friendly and helpful staff. We forgot to bring our EU adapter to charge the camera but luckily they had a collection of adapters to choose from which we borrowed for the rest of our stay! The hotel and room looks and feels like it has been recently renovated. The lift is very small (max 2 people) - but it didn't bother us - could be claustrophobic for some but there's the stairs alternative. There's a safe in every room and fridge and wall mounted flat screen tv. The bathroom is immaculate with a great shower although small to medium size (it has a medium size bath). The bed is comfy and promises a good night sleep. We felt we were getting 4 star quality (not considering room size) for the price of a 3 star hotel - which is a great deal!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our Expectations”
Reviews.Author: 70south
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Agora St. Germain 19-25 February. The area is perfect..very centrally located and the staff was extremely helpful! Most spoke english which was good for us since we don't speak more than a few words of french.
