The room was small compared to American standards but worked out just fine since we were only in it to sleep. This is an incredibly clean hotel...the bathroom was modern and spotless. Everything was great except for the bed.....not sure if it was just us but the bed wasn't real comfortable...my back hurt every morning. But really, everything else was fabulous...the bed was only a very minor thing. There are two great bakeries around the corner that were great for a quick breakfast and there is a little grocery store one block over....this hotel is ideal for anyone wanting a clean, convenient hotel at a reasonable price. The customer service is great...we would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Robbed by Hotel Staff”
Reviews.Author: CH405
Reviews.Content: Unfortuantely, my wife and I had the same experience as another customer who traveled there in November 2009. I had purchased a brand new watch for my wife's birthday and to avoid her seeing it, I hid it beneath clothing in a closet (of note it wouldn't have fit in the lock box regardless as it is about as deep and long as a dollar bill.) The morning of our flight out, I found the watch and the box it was in no longer in my closet. Just like the other customer, they knew we were from the states and when we were checking out to catch an international flight, so they stole from us the evening before. So we had to deal with this as we were trying to leave for the airport. The man at the front desk said it was not his staff and offered the ridiculous excuse that "all the hotel rooms in Paris have a universal key, so it could have been anyone." Are you kidding me? When I asked him if there was $3000 damage to the room, could I just say it wasn't me, someone else has a universal key, he said no I'd charge you. He was not bright enough to see the comparison. Further, while having this conversation, my wife came down to the desk to report that a credit card was stolen as well. All the man did was direct us to a police station. We filed a report, cancelled the card (not after they tried charging over 8000 Euro; unfortunately 3000 got approved) and made our flight. With all the hotels in Paris, just find somewhere else to stay. DO NOT risk getting your things stolen by these awful people.

Reviews.Title: “central but quiet clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: hikerwalker
Reviews.Content: spent alot of time on the web searching for a hotel and was very pleased with the result this hotel is central enough to be able to walk to most of the main sites and though we didnt find any particularly good restaurants very close - but a short walk and you could find any type of cuisine. We had asked for a high quiet room and were pleased to be given one - unlike in other hotels where they often do not take note of your requests. Though the room wasnt huge it was adequate as we were really only there to sleep and it was clean and warm We didnt have breakfast as we were out first thing - i only wish they would have a kettle in the room to be able to make a cup of tea! All the Receptionists spoke good english and were quite chatty. LIft is small but not a problem

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location. Nice, warm and clean”
Reviews.Author: Klodette
Reviews.Content: I spent one night in January 2010. The location is good, near the tube station with a boulangerie next door and many shops and cafè nearby. In one of the best area of Paris. The staff is friendly. I had a single room: not too big, ok for one person. The bed was a queen size, quite confy. Room was warm and bathroom perfectly clean. I would defenitly come back again. I also got a good rate buying the all package from Eurostar website. Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “lovely stay in paris!”
Reviews.Author: Leemce
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a great location. Only meters away from the metro and touristy things!! Plenty of restuarants and nightlife within walking distance. The rooms were very clean and the decor was very modern and nice. Rooms small but good size compared to other European hotels I have visited. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The is not much in the hotel besides the breakfast room and bedroom but when you're in paris I doubt you'll be spending much time in the hotel. Had a wonderful time and would recommend this hotel. Lee

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel/Location/Service”
Reviews.Author: Mutumia
Reviews.Content: After having a rather stressful few days in London wondering if the Eurostar would resolve it's problems, my granddaughter & I were happy to arrive at the Hotel (albeit three days later than originally planned) and settled into our twin room on the 6th floor overlooking the street, which was just perfect! The beds are narrow but comfortable, the bathroom nicely fitted. There is a wall safe & fridge which we made use of. We had only one breakfast in the dining room which we did not do justice to as we were not as hungry as we had thought, so the next few days we went to Eric Kayser's around the corner on rue Monge. Having visited Paris with my husband in the past two years, staying in a hotel on rue Sommerard and an apartment on rue Frederic Sauton we always enjoy the area around Place Maubert. The metro is very convenient, also the Batobus when you get a little tired from walking (which is really the best way to see the city). The Hotel Staff were very helpful and put up with my few words of French - would definitely recommend this great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Exlcellent location”
Reviews.Author: timk93
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 6 nights beginning December 30th and had a wonderful time. The staff was excellent and the location perfect. We had no trouble finding the hotel from the RER station located down the street. The staff was amazing. Our maid did a great job cleaning our room every day and was very friendly. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in a central location in Paris. The room was small, but we had no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Short Break”
Reviews.Author: Dayzt04
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel of 2 nights (27th & 28th Dec 09) with my wife, 5 month old daughter and parents and would highly recommend it. This is the second occasion I have stayed here and again I was not dissapointed. It is very clean, central and very reasonably priced for the central location. For transfers with infants/children I can also highly recommend Paris City Line (Paris-City-Line.com)

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Agora lived up to expectations.”
Reviews.Author: MignonneFlorida
Reviews.Content: Warmly greeted and recognized by receptioniste, we were grateful for the efficient elevator, quiet room and all expected amenities. Although typically small, the room held, very narrow twin beds, 2 night stands, 2 chairs, a desk and generous french door that allowed sunlight and fresh air. Bathroom was comfortable, very modern and towels were new and fluffy. Breakfast, at 11 Euros, was served in a spacious,charmingly decorated basement area. Croissants were fresh and there was a wholesome variety included in the price. Hot eggs, to order, were available at an extra charge. A request to print out boarding passes was cheerfully met. We had very cold, wet weather. Having a Metro stop only 2 blocks away was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Good value for short stays!”
Reviews.Author: LizzieL78
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Agora Saint Germain for two nights at the end of November, Sat 28th and Sun 29th with my boyfriend for a short sight seeing trip. Got a great deal by booking through the 'Eurostar' website as a package for the Eurostar travel and the hotel for approx £315 for us both. The hotel is in a great location, 3 minutes from the river, 5 minutes from Notre Dame and a metro within about 3 minutes walk. Best location I have ever stayed in, in Paris. Lots of choices of restaurants and bars withing easy walking distance too. Some good 'menu prix fixe' in the streets round about Notre Dame, we found dinner for 18 euros for 3 courses on the Sunday night. Drinks are very expensive in Paris at the moment, expect to pay 5 euros at least for a tea / coffee and anything up to 10 euros for a pint of draft beer. There isn't a kettle in the hotel room and room service didnt appear to be an option, luckily we had taken a travel kettle with us. Our room on the 4th floor was more than adequate, though it was baking hot and we couldn't seem to turn the temperature down at all, ended up sleeping with the big french windows open. It also meant we couldnt put jumpers and coats on in the room and needed to wait until we were in the hotel lobby to do this! It was also quite dark and the light wasn't good at all for putting make up on. The bathroom - sink, toilet and shower, wasn't a bad size for Paris and there was plenty of hot water. TV in the room picked up BBC World Service. Cleanliness was fine though the walls could use a lick of paint as there were some dirty marks on them. Didnt have breakfast in the hotel but it was available for 11 euros. There was an '8 to 8' convenience store just round the corner which was handy as well as a great boulangerie. Would recommend due to the location but be wary of the warmth of the hotel room - in the summer it would have been very uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “MONEY STOlen- BEWARE BEWARE”
Reviews.Author: nf931986
Reviews.Content: Well, After a long day I feel alseep around 8:00pm and woke up at 2:00am to still find my younger siste on the computer. I kicked her off of it and told her to go to bed and then started do some online banking, to get ready for our depature tommorow at 9:00am. I went to get our wallets which we hid away since their are no safes here and well my money way gone ( $ 600 ) .I quickly woke up my sister and had her check hers and yes It was gone also ( $ 800) dollars. I ran down stairs at 2:30 am to the suppose 24/hrs desk to find the doors locked. Now mind you this is the only way out of the hotel. Luckyly I remember their is a door to the basement breakfast area so I went down their and up another flight of stairs to inside the lobby. I found it pitch dark and the service man sleeping on the floor. He told me to write down some information and It can not be taken care of until 7:30 am when someone else arrives, mind you I need to be at the airport for 9:00am. So now I tried to call the police , but I can not speak french and all the poilce man could do on the phone is say I do not understand, thank god I was not dieing or anything. On top of all that when you leave the hotel every time the make you leave you key at the front desk and you pick it up when you come back. SO either the dam maid stole it or one of the staff members. This hotel made our end of traveling come to ones worst nightmare. They can not be trusted- TERRIBLE TERRIBLE!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff / Location”
Reviews.Author: HaroldToronto
Reviews.Content: Thank you Pascale and staff for all the assistance, directions and recommendations to make our Paris visit special. Great hotel location close to the Seine River, Notre Dame, Subway and the many other Paris attractions. Room was the same size as N.Y. city hotel room at half the price. We did not come to Paris to stay in our room, so all was well with our room size. Washroom was updated with new fixtures and tiles. It had that clean and fresh look. Bed was good and room serviced each day. Beautiful old church directly across from the hotel with working bells. This is what a trip to Paris is all about old world history. Lots of local bakeries, shops, patios and places to eat at all price levels. Local farmers market on certain days and a few small grocery stores to stock you mini bar fridge with frest fruit etc. I will recommend this hotel to friends heading to Paris. Harold Canada

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: scondo05
Reviews.Content: All reviews on this hotel are correct. The location is unbeatable and the service was very friendly. Both of these were extremely important to us since this was our first trip to Paris. The bathroom was very hip and updated, which I appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: cptvn
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent location with walking distance to the metro, many good restaurants and Notre Dame. There are two negative things to note. One is the elevator broke on the last two days requiring us walking up and down from our near the top floor and to carry our suitcases down on our last day. The other is we had no control on the air conditioning. It was turned off for the season. The room was too warm during the day requiring us to leave the window open which gives no privacy. At night we had to leave the window open until it cools down enough. But then we had to get up to close the window before the morning to cut down the street noise. For the price that we paid this is truly a nuissance. Otherewise, it is good hotel in an excellent location. The staff was very helpful and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “American friendly staff, GREAT LOCATION, and large, remodeled bathrooms.”
Reviews.Author: Lance399
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Paris and the Agora St. Germain suited us well. The area was perfect with shops, restaurants, and fantastic bakeries. Walking distance from the Seine, Notre Dame, the Louvre, and plenty of Metro stations. St. Germain is a wonderful, well-lit, safe neighborhood. Perfect mid-range hotel for the budget conscious. Save money by taking the Metro to most places instead of paying for high-priced tours. All have various language, self-guided tour hearing devices for little $. Eurail was having a sale at the time we were there, so we planned ahead for a day trip to London. Best to research on the internet what you would like to see prior to leaving. You may get some great deals!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at hotel -- very helpful staff; great location of Paris.”
Reviews.Author: amyGoBlue
Reviews.Content: First trip to Paris and had a great experience at this hotel. Great area of Paris, close to everything (especially Notre Dame, Ile St. Louis, St. Germain, even Louvre and Orsay Museum). Hotel was located on side street off of main boulevards in the Latin Quarter so it was pretty quiet at night. Staff was very helpful with any questions we had about the city, touristy sites/arrangements, taxis to train station etc. (and spoke English very well). Rooms were a little small, but to be expected. Rooms and bathrooms were very clean. Our bathroom looked like it had been recently updated. Would definitely recommend to people that are in Paris for a few days and want a moderately priced small boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a decent price in a great area”
Reviews.Author: plumkrazy80
Reviews.Content: The placement of this hotel is perfect if you are wanting to see all the sights and sounds. Only 2 blocks from the Notre Dame and 2-3 blocks to the Metro Subway. Also only minutes walk to Le Pantheon and Au Jardin du Luxembourg. We were able to take the Metro to all the famous sights around Paris. The hotel was superb and the hotel staff was absolutely fantastic. They were very helpful and accommodating. Giving us information and directions even when we didn't ask. It was wonderful. They rooms were typical European style and had air conditioning that worked very well. Hotel Agora Saint Germain was a great place to stay at during our trip and we will definitely be back!!

Reviews.Title: “ILL BE BACK...”
Reviews.Author: ShacharM
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location minutes Walk from all main attractions. The rooms are small but clean and modern . The staff were very friendly and helpful. You can skip the breakfast and visit the neer by Boulangerie.

Reviews.Title: “great location, very nice hotel, staff very helpful”
Reviews.Author: spain2004
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay at this Hotel while on a 3 day visit to Paris. It is in a very safe area ( we returned from Eiffel Tower on a train at 12 midnight and felt safe walking back to this Hotel ) It is a great locatioin, near Notre Dame Cathedral and a short walk from the trains. We were on the 5th floor facing the street and left our balcony door open at night and did not have a noise problem. Breakfast is served between 7am and 10 am and costs 11 Euro, It is a very nice and very clean Hotel with a baggage room downstairs. Eileen USA

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in good position”
Reviews.Author: flendher
Reviews.Content: Close to Notre Dame and to Latin Quarter, easy to reach by metro. Rooms are very nice and clean. Good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was great, staff were lovely and the room was small but very nice.”
Reviews.Author: Sydney2009Sydney
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this Hotel. It was centrally located and we found it very easy and safe to get around. The room was small but very nice, however although advertised as being air conditioned, we were told that it wasn't working. We had a window into the court yard area, but at times it was a little noisy. The hotel staff were wonderful, very friendly and very fluent in English, which helped with our lack of French. The breakfast was more than adequate and overall we would recommend this as a great place to stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, comfortable, clean - and close to Notre Dame”
Reviews.Author: rosesoleil
Reviews.Content: In the Latin Quarter, close to Notre Dame, RER and metro. I wanted quiet, clean and good value, and got it. The single room was small and well-laid out, everything worked and the desk staff were helpful. I wheeled my bag in from the St. Michel - Notre Dame RER on arrival (about 10 minutes walk), but was happy to ask the concierge to book me a place on the airport shuttle back to CDG, it went door to door. That gave me time to walk round the corner to a cafe on Place Monge for breakfast the day I left - and for a quick visit to the market in the square. I liked the neighbourhood, and walked everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and good location”
Reviews.Author: oldage27
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during our whirlwind trip to Paris last weekend and were quite happy. The rooms were average, but we didn't plan on spending any time inside any way so they suited our needs perfectly. The bathroom was wonderful (I'm picky about bathrooms!) and everything was very clean. The air conditioning is still broken. They said there are a few rooms that have air con, but they reserve those for the elderly and sick. Instead they have desktop fans in every room which actually help cool down the rooms quite quickly. The weather was perfect outside so we didn't mind having no air con. I could see how it would be rough in mid-summer. Like I said, we were more interested in price since we did not plan to hang out in our room anyway and this hotel was an excellent value. Its location to the St. Michael metro stop was wonderful because from there you could get anywhere. We did breakfast at the Eric Kayser boulangerie and would highly recommend that to people. It is just around the corner on Rue Monge from the hotel. We did not try the hotel breakfast because of the cost. I think breakfast for two at the boulangerie was 6-7 Euro as opposed to 11 Euro per person at the hotel. The service was wonderful. We emailed one week prior looking for reservations for dinner for the night of our arrival. The staff took care of hooking us up with a wonderful restaurant within walking distance- "La Maree Verte". It worked out perfectly. Overall, we liked it and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: mattgreenville
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here over a long weekend, and we very much enjoyed this hotel. We arrived on a Friday morning too early to check in, but the hotel has a luggage storage room we were able to use. The hotel is on a relatively quiet side-street, but close enough to walk to all the action in the Latin Quarter. We felt very safe walking to/from the hotel at any hour. The hotel offers a breakfast, but we chose to eat at one of the several walkable bakeries each morning instead. The staff was pleasant and helpful if we had any questions, and offered to call an airport service for our trip home. The rooms are average sized by Paris standards. The bed was comfortable, and we had plenty of closet space and a desk. The bathroom looks recently updated, and is clean and modern. My ONLY complaint would be the size of the shower. I'm an average size person, and it was a pretty tight fit. It would be very difficult to shower together with your spouse. Otherwise, this hotel is a good value, and we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good...”
Reviews.Author: a2222
Reviews.Content: Considering this is Paris, the hotel was reasonably priced. It's decent and clean and close to the Metro, a nice outdoor market and other shopping and cafes. The front desk staff was always pleasant and spoke enough English to answer our questions. There's no restaurant on site, but they do offer a continental breakfast for a decent price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Muggy73
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend on the first weekend of September 2009. Read several Trip Advsior reports which said this hotel was pretty good - and indeed it was. After arriving at CDG we took the RER line into Paris to the St Michel stop and walked from there to the hotel - took literally less than 10 minutes, not to mention the first thing you are greeted with is the Notre Dame Cathedral. The lobby made an excellent first impression; modern and clean. The chap at the reception spoke very good english (i think he probably got bored with my poor attempts at French) and was very friendly. Stayed on the top floor (Rm 608) which was a double with WC/Shower ensuite. Decent size (For Paris), very comfortable bed, air con if you needed, very clean and a decent shower. I could not fault the room at all. It is in an ideal location (Latin Quarter) and everything is easily accessible from the Hotel. The metro is only a block away if you wanted to venture further. Lots of bakeries, cafes nearby and only a short walk to find restaurants/bistros/brasseries in the St Germain area or Pantheon area too. Didn't opt for the breakfast (11 Euros, I believe) so i can't comment on that - i preferred my breakfast outside near the Notre Dame or the Louvre. They had no problem in leaving my luggage in the baggage room on my departure (late flight home) and had facilities for a quick wash and change before actually leaving. Overall: A decent hotel with friendly staff. Very modern and clean. If staying in Paris again - i would definately go back. PS - If you are claustrophobic, i wouldn't take the lift; it is very small and will only fit 3 people max!

Reviews.Title: “Second visit, as good as always- can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: roisinp
Reviews.Content: This is the seciond time I have stayed in this hotel - we stayed ion February and again in August - and once again I am very inpressed. The rooms are not huge - the phrase small but perfectly formed comes to mind, as you have high quality bathroom, plasma tv etc. You can have breakfast at the hotel but in the middle of Paris, with so many eateries, why would you? The hotel is right beside a square with bistros and cafes on every side of it, so lots of choice. Staff very friendly and happy to give you tips and directions for how to get the most from your stay. They all speak English and Spanish too from what I could pick up. The location is really central; a couple of minutes from the river and notre dame. Close to the metro which takes you to all the sites - don't be nervous about using it, its the cheapest, quickest and fastest way to get around and easy to use - just ask the staff for help if you're not sure. Highly recommend it! One note - there is a lift but its very small so not great for families with lots of luggage/pushchairs. But for solo travellers, couples etc its perfect!

Reviews.Title: “4 out of 5”
Reviews.Author: ar_elwood
Reviews.Content: The hotel is excellent from the lobby to the bedroom I could not fault a single thing apart from the lift which we never used but always seemed to keep people waiting. The room was clean and tidy and for a 3 star hotel we had an air con unit which helped to make the very hot weather very manageable. Breakfast started early and went on to a reasonable hour if you do not feel like getting up very early. The location is ideal if want to walk or if you want grab a metro the nearest station is 2 minute walk. The pubs near by are excellent I would recommend the “long Hop” we were treated to a acoustic set, the drinks were expensive but typical of Paris prices.

Reviews.Title: “Graet Location and friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: BigDlittlead
Reviews.Content: The Agora Saint Germain Hotel is located in the Latin Quarter just three blocks from Notre Dame Cathedral. The area has a multitude of restaurants shops and bakeries. The hotel is clean and neat and the rooms are a little small but have all new barthrooms. The staff is very friendly and extremely helpful. We especially liked dealing with Erick. The only draw back was the air conditioning for our room was broken and we were there in August (hot). We would definately stay her again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value & Location”
Reviews.Author: SBOP
Reviews.Content: Our forth visit to this Hotel over a 9 year period. It has been renovated during this time. Rooms are small (typical of Paris Hotels) and the lift tiny ! Service has always been great, particularly this visit. Its an excellent location, walk down the Rue and within minutes you are standing at the rear of Notre Dame. Very clean and tidy hotel, recommended.

Reviews.Title: “The ole' switcheroo”
Reviews.Author: gg47671
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, I never got to stay in Hotel Agora St. Germain. After spending 2 weeks agonizing over what hotel to stay in during our trip to Paris, I selected this hotel because of the combination of price, reviews, location and pictures. It turns out that we were put in their OTHER location, Hotel Agora (in Les Halles). A great location, but a far inferior hotel. When we wrote a nice letter in french asking to be switched to the hotel that we had actually booked (St Germain), they told us we could stay there, but for 60 euro more a NIGHT. I looked on their website and the price it gave you was only 20 euro more a night than we had booked - months earlier. I wrote another nice, French language email pointing this out and they pretty much said take it or leave it. Aside from crappy quality of the other Agora in Les Halles that they had moved us to, I wasn't about to further trust this company after hanging us out to dry. The St. Germain location seems really nice and a good deal, just MAKE SURE when you get your confirmation you're at the right address. We had to scramble to find somewhere just 10 days before our trip, but ended up renting an apartment in the Marais for a week. (which I'd recommend instead of staying in a cramped hotel!!!!)

Reviews.Title: “Great latin qtr place”
Reviews.Author: LM2Australia
Reviews.Content: Great location! 5 mins walk to all the action in Latin Quarter/Notre Dame, but quiet enough to get some sleep and feel you're living like a local. Fantatsic patisserie around the corner and cheese shop too. There's a weekend market in the corner too for some great food provisions. Staff were a bit hit and miss - one guy was fantastic, the other very much not. We had a twin room on the top floor. Room was small and reasonably cramped but very clean and priced well so we were really happy. And air con, thank god! (Although the people next to us had the air con broken and the reception guy point blank refused to fix it/give them a better rate. Ahhhhh, french hospitality!)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a quiet aerea close to evth”
Reviews.Author: vt287
Reviews.Content: First, I rarely write reviews. But I think this hotel deserves one. 1. Hotel is in a very convenient place: <10mins to Notre Dame de Paris, <15mins to Pantheon, <20mins to Louvre, ... So if you plan to walk in Paris this is a good place to stay. It is also close to a railway station and it took us about 45mins to get here from the airport. One could also get a minivan service for few euros more. 2. Hotel itself is very "compact" but it is in an old building so it is excusable. Rooms are clean, air-conditioned and look new. 3. Hotel staff is very helpful -- if you want they will tell were to go, how to get there, where to buy things and will arrange things for you. It is absolutely not a problem if you do not parlez francais much. 4. St. Victor restaurant is just around the corner. It is a fairly good and reasonably priced choice. There are many other choice if you walk towards St.Germain.

Reviews.Title: “A great base for Paris exploration”
Reviews.Author: jenckes
Reviews.Content: We stayed her for over a week and found the hotel to be an ideal base from which to see museums, get to fine restaurants and bistrots, and walk to the Ile de Cite or along the Seine within minutes from our front door. The Metro stop is a two minute walk. The rooms were clean, beds adequate, and service personnel delightful. They have upgraded almost everything in the past year or so, and the elevator is a welcomed asset for returning from a large meal in the evening. Breakfasts were well presented.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel not only for the business trip :)”
Reviews.Author: depechmaniac
Reviews.Content: Nice and perfect service Room was ok, however air condition was not working. Service had excellent idea to put the fan to the room. Plus for it. It's a pertfect place. Very close to the oldest down town, means Catedre Notre Dame, Hotel de Ville etc.

Reviews.Title: “We feel like visitors here, not tourists and we love the area too.”
Reviews.Author: parisbuddy
Reviews.Content: There is a special connection for us. We searched 2 years ago when we went to Paris for a charming, historic,( modern where it counts), comfortable, rooms w/views etc; hotel. Did I mention moderately priced for what you enjoy? The neighborhood has it all, famous bakery, multi day farmers/vendors markets footsteps away from the lobby, a metro stop that connects you to all of Paris outside the door as well. I got my hair done a block from our hotel to see the Madonna concert. Ladies can relate to this. I needed a good cut and massive highlights and I speak like two words of French. My husband was so thrilled and the concert was a part of many things we did. I won't go into our whole itinerary here, but it was always a treasured part of our get away to start and end our day in this special hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible location and a really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: turnerk1
Reviews.Content: The room was actually great and beautifully decorated, but there was something wrong with the air conditioning in the room and in the time we were there, they didn't fix the problem. The room became very hot. Otherwise I would have given the hotel 5 stars on everything.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Updated and Modern, Great Location, Clean”
Reviews.Author: TravelersDenver
Reviews.Content: This was a great find, and still somewhat affordable. It was updated, with modern and 'westernized' facilities, and in an excellent location. Walking distance to Notre Dame and great cafes and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, good location. Beware of wifi and A/C hiccups.”
Reviews.Author: MochiFan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week. The hotel is in a good location, within walking distance of Notre Dame and many restaurants (though not many high-end restaurants). The room was small but very clean. If you want a quieter room, ask for one facing the inside courtyard rather than the street. Even though the web site says all rooms have air conditioning, it was working only on the 2nd, 3rd, and 6th floors (out of 6 floors) when we were there. Also, the free wifi was flaky; it stopped working on 3 of the 7 evenings, and they didn't fix it until the next morning. The staff was generally helpful and spoke English well.

Reviews.Title: “Great locaton; helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: ajatravel
Reviews.Content: The fabulous location of the hotel is its best amenity. The rooms are basic but functional. We were very dissappointed that the air conditioning wasn't working, but staff did their best to accomadate. Staff was always helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel, Decent Rooms, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JadieR
Reviews.Content: just got back from my first trip to Paris and I loved this hotel! The rooms are nothing to write home about - pretty tiny, but they're perfectly adequate and the location and views are superb. The staff is friendly and breakfast is a good value. All in all a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Consistantly good, over a number of visits”
Reviews.Author: Grimlet
Reviews.Content: It's clean, everything works, the staff are friendly. It's just what you would expect for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great (and safe) location, nice staff, love to stay here”
Reviews.Author: Crickettt
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth or fifth time at the Agora. It is well-located, two or three block up from Notre Dame on the Left. Lots of restaurants nearby, as well as Maubert Metro Stop. Spotlessly clean. Not fancy, but perfectly fine. Nice front desk staff (Aline and Eric during the day and a v nice man at night. ) I will certainly go back there when I return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A great find”
Reviews.Author: theartgirl
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel, spotlessly clean, in a convenient neighbourhood. My single room was on the small side, but was by no means the smallest I've stayed in in Paris, and was good value. Service is extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel is around the corner from the Metro, around the corner from a wonderful boulangerie, and well-located for the 3rd, 4th, and 6th arrondissements in particular. My only suggestions for improvement would be to increase/improve the lighting in the room, which is fairly low level.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Choice”
Reviews.Author: fishertrick
Reviews.Content: We selected Hotel Agora through Trip Advisor reviews. It was a fantastic choice. The highlights of this hotel are the location, the assistance from front desk staff, and it is reasonably priced. We walked all through Paris from this location and it is conveniently located close to many train stations. We would definitely return to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: historyisgreat
Reviews.Content: The rooms wer a bit small, but consistent with other hotels in large European cities. Breakfast was not include, but it was available for 7 euros in a very nice dining area with a good selection of cereals, fruit, juices, coffee and pastries. The location in Latin Quarter was great and near the Seine and close to Notre Dame and the Louvre. Being in the Latin Quarter, there were numerous restaurants and side walk cafe's. The streets were very active at night and great for people watching. It was definitely a hotel I recommend.

Reviews.Title: “OK If You Aren't Intending on Staying in Your Room”
Reviews.Author: fleet7
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights here, and while I can't fault the location or the cleanliness the room had zero ambience. This probably wouldn't have bothered us if we hadn't been forced to spend most of the four days inside owing to my husband suffering a sever bout of bronchitis. We had booked a standard room but I would book a superior next time. The window opened out to a wall. The female receptionist was fairly grumpy. The rooms are clean and the hotel is in a great location but I wouldn't go back or if I did I would definitely book a superior room. The wireless internet works well, but don't bother with breakfast, there are plenty of great pastry shops nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, clean, and modern with great service.”
Reviews.Author: traveller987399
Reviews.Content: Spent a week at this hotel. Rooms were clean, modern/updated, and were all that you could ask for at a reasonable price. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Look no further if you want an extremely comfortable room that can serve as a base to explore the city. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: JonNL
Reviews.Content: Unbeatable location near Quartier Latin, a block from Notre Dame and Pantheon. Very friendly and welcoming english-speaking staff. The room was excellent, on the first floor overlooking the quaint church across the square. The view of the church is nice but the churchbells may wake you in the morning. We didn't have the breakfast, as there are tons of bakeries nearby. I'll certainly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: mygreyhound66
Reviews.Content: Receptionist Eric, absolutely terrific ! He was friendly and extremely helpful, also he had a great sense of humour and we enjoyed many laughs. The location is excellently situated with options for metro, and bus within steps. Lots of dining choices in the vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: TonysNewJersey
Reviews.Content: booked this hotel aftering reading reveiws. The hotel was outstanding in every way, staff very helpful in so many ways. Hotel spotless, located a few blocks for the Seine river and Notra Dame close to so many places, would recomend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: CHB_FL
Reviews.Content: We had read that rooms were small, but having just spent 14 nights ona cruis ship, we found the rooms to be very adequate. We stayed in Room 409, and it was decorated nicely, and the bathroom, while smaller than typical US hotels, was more than adequate. The staff was friendly, the wireless internet worked well, and the room was clean. It is true that the baggage storage is not locked, but there was usually someone nearby when we were putting our luggage in and taking it out. i would advise to be prudent and just lock the luggage to be on the safe side, not due to any particular event. The proximity to the Metro stop, and the Notre Dame Cathedral made visiting sights very easy. The lift was small, but adeguate for two persons and a bag of luggage or two. They do serve breakfast, but we opted for pastries and coffee form one of the pastry shops nearby. Overall, it was an enjoyable stay, even though it was just one night. We woudl stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Ecowoman
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights in April 2009. In the Latin Quarter, and close to lots of little shops (charcuterie, boulangerie, fromagerie) and the Metro. Typical of Parisien rooms, it's tight, but the bed was reasonable comfortable, there was a closet with space to hang and store clothing. The bathroom was small (again typical of Paris), but had been recently re-appointed. When I booked, I thought I was getting a window out onto the street, but instead got a window looking into the centre of the building, and what appeared to be aircon machinery for another neighbouring building on our level. There was a little courtyard down below, and you could almost see the sky above....Ah well, c'est la vie....its not like we spent a whole lot of time in our room anyway!! It's pretty basic, clean and the front desk staff were friendly and helpful, which is everything I need in a 2 star.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel! Stayed here last 2X!”
Reviews.Author: NotreDameNYC
Reviews.Content: I really love this hotel. I stayed here the last two times I was in Paris. The staff is really wonderful- helpful, professional and extremely nice. The room/bathroom are kept really clean and neat. Plus, the location can't be beat. I felt really safe at all times, plus the have a small safes for valuables, which is an added bonus for feeling safe. The metro stop-Maubert Mutilite- is about a 3 minute walk from the hotel, plus 3 times a week, a outside authentic market is set up right in front of the metro station. The hotel is also a very short walk to Notre Dame, so everynight I took a walk to relax and people watch, plus eat Bethillion ,Paris' best icecream! For breakfast, Erik Kaiser bakery is about 3 doors down which has the best chocolate crossaints and creme cafe in Paris! I usually drank my coffee and mapped out the day's plan while eating breakfast here. Back at the hotel, Arlene and Eric are the front desk people I had the most contact with and they are wonderful. The rooms are kind of small, but really, how much time are you going to be in your room when you are in Paris? Free Wifi is also provided.I hope to return to Paris this summer and will definetly be staying at The Hotel Agora Saint Germain.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfying stay at a great location”
Reviews.Author: rabella
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights at this Hotel. The rooms were clean with a comfy bed. As in most European hotels the rooms were the typical European size. Had a flat screen 17" tv and nicely decorated. The staff was friendly. The best part was the location. The hotel is only three blocks from Notre Dame on a side street so the noise is not an issue. And it is only three block to the Metro. Close to everything you need including patisserie and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Just what I needed”
Reviews.Author: kokosNicosia
Reviews.Content: Near to everything. Nice coffeshops and bistro in the neighberhood. Simple and french!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal base for Paris”
Reviews.Author: Cambrico
Reviews.Content: We used Tripadvisor to find this hotel and we don't regret our choice. Hotel is very well situated, near the Saint Germain Boulevard. We arrived through Charles de Gaulle, took the RER for 8 Euros each and left at Notre Dame St Michel Station, just 500 m from the hotel. With a Google map you can find the hotel without problems. It is located at a short walk from Notre Dame, the Maubert Mutualite Metro Station and the Boulevard St Germain. We came back every night at midnight, without any problems with security or any bad experience. The rooms are small but we both were confortable. The bathroom clean and modern. Wi Fi available. Breakfast is not extraordinary but it is good. Sometimes we had it to save time and others we went outside. The personnel was friendly and helpful. For Spanish speaking people, Eric, that speaks French, Spanish and English, is invaluable. All other personnel was allways of great help. No complaint of any kind about them. We recommend this hotel for its personnel, rooms, location, and all at a very affordable price. We used it as base to explore Paris in our first visit to this extraordinary city.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for Paris Sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: jammer54
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the Latin Quarter - a short stroll from Notre Dame. There is, however, no metro station very close to the hotel. the hotel is a satisfactory Paris hotel for people who come to see the city. As in Paris in general, the rooms are small. We had to get creative in order to find a place for our suitcases. Breakfast is a good continental spread. Staff is cordial and rooms are clean. Assuming you are in town to see the city and not stay in your room - what more do you need? My only complaint is the tiny elevator - not comfortable for a guy 1.90m. tall and weighing 100kg. Couldn't get in with the luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Bighead5
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed there the first week of April, and it was the perfect choice for us. You are five minutes walk to Notre Dame, and have quick access to all the fun in the Latin Quarter. The street the hotel is on felt very safe, even when we were wandering around at 2 A.M. It was also a big plus having an ATM right outside the hotel. The room felt spacious by European standards, but if you're a big guy (like me) I wouldn't recommend trying to take a bath in their little tub! It can get a little noisy at night outside on the weekend, fortunately I had brought some earplugs. The only english speaking channel they get is CNN, but who goes to Paris to sit in there room and watch TV? The staff was very friendly, and everyone we talked to spoke english very well. I would definitely recommend this hotel if you are looking for a fun area to stay in. If you are looking for lots of peace and quiet this probably isn't the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a very good location”
Reviews.Author: Reiseschnecke
Reviews.Content: Rooms a little small but still very nice and really clean! We'll definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location; Great price”
Reviews.Author: Gilldog12
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this hotel. The location is perfect for exploring the Left Bank and it's also close to a Metro stop so you can easily reach the rest of Paris. The rooms were very clean and modern. The reception area was nice and the staff were all very friendly. A great price for a solid three star hotel. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable room, good service, great value.”
Reviews.Author: XtineB
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights and picked this hotel because of the location, price, and the fact that they had free internet - important for some research I was trying to complete after spending the day photographing the city. Please note that while the internet is indeed free, they have a limited number of codes for the day and I got alot of grief initially when I complained when I could not get the free access they advertised because they did not have anymore codes. Firm but pleasant persistence paid off and I was accommodated. I would have given them a 5 star in service had I not had to put up a fight (there was alot of back and forth and being told it was my fault for not telling someone how important it was for me to have internet) but ultimately they were able to find a solution and I am grateful for their efforts. I only write this here to give you the heads up that "free" may come with some stipulations and restrictions so make sure you ask all of the right questions if it is important to you. Other than this hiccup, everything else was wonderful. The room was sound-proofed so I had a very quiet sleep, there is air-con and heating, but I kept my windows open mostly. The room is clean, big for paris (you and your luggage will fit!) and modern. There is a small lift. It is in a darn near perfect location, with easy access from the Metro and walking distance to the Seine and Notre Dame. If I were to stay in this part of the city again, I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location, friendly staff, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: NCbeachy
Reviews.Content: This was a great little hotel. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms are small, but big enough. They were very clean and the bathroom was nice with good water pressure in the shower. It was a terrific location, in the heart of Paris but you felt very safe. You are only a couple of blocks from the Notre Dame and one block from the subway, but you can walk everywhere. The bakery on the corner, Eric Kaisers, has terrific pastries (but beautiful pastries are everywhere) and very good bread. There are several grocery stores near by so you can buy snacks and take them to the river for a picnic. We also found lots of good places to buy fresh chicken and on St Germain Blvd there is a small Greek store that has really good salads. There is an Irish Pub, le Galway, a few blocks away that you can have a pint of Guiness and look at the Notre Dame, nice people. Watch out for the gypsies and their gold ring scam, otherwise it is a great place to visit, I wish I was still there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MAROAthens
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent five nights in this small hotel at the end of January. This was our third visit to Paris and I can say that this hotel’s room was small, but bigger than the other two hotels’ rooms (both of them in four-star hotels) we had previously stayed in. Our room was on the fourth floor, it was clean, it had a small balcony overlooking the church, which was very nice, but the double bed was small and uncomfortable. The bathroom was modern, clean and of adequate size. The breakfast was very limited and if it was not included in our rate we would prefer to have breakfast in one of the many small cafés around the hotel. The reception employees were polite and very helpful. The hotel is very well located, two blocks from the Notre Dame and very close to the metro station. There are many restaurants and cafes near the hotel and this is a very safe neigh-borhood. I could recommend this hotel and stay here again, but the next time I shall ask for twin beds in the hope that they will be bigger and more comfortable and I shall get a rate without breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marjorylondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in January and thought the hotel was well located. It was a short walk to all of the sites and just around the corner from a great Boulangerie. The hotel was very comfortable and clean. We would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location & very clean/nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: amr10
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location by St Germain and the Latin Quarter. We loved that we could walk right to the Seine and had a lot of choices of cafes and restaurants in clsoe proximity. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful and the rooms were very clean and more than sufficient. We will definitely be back and will recommend Hotel Agora to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay at the Agora St. Germain”
Reviews.Author: dnerina
Reviews.Content: I read about the Agora St. Germain on Tripadvisor.com. I was looking for a nice and clean 3-star hotel in Paris for a reasonable price. The reviews seemed very positive so I decided to go on the hotel website and booked my 4-nights stay taking advantage of the excellent rate offer. My overall experience in Paris was wonderful. The hotel location is ideal for those who are looking to be in the centre of the city but away from the busy and noisy streets. The room was a bit small but clean and comfortable. The bathroom completely renovated with and excellent shower. Staff was kind and friendly and room service very good. The Latin Quarter and the Notre Dame Cathedral are just a few minutes walk from the hotel as well as the closest metro station, restaurants and cafes which make this hotel a perfect place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location / Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: Marksmen
Reviews.Content: This hotel is AWESOME. Ignore the reviews that worry you about the church bells, we slept through them every morning. The internet worked great. I downloaded a movie every day to watch at night in bed on the lap top which was kind of romantic. The bathrooms are completely remodeled. The people at the front desk let us check in at 8am which was priceless after 16 hours of travel. Its a 2 block walk to Notre Dame. A romantic stroll to the Louve and our favorite night was when we walked to the Arc D"Triomph (sorry about my spelling). We cant wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Teddy2009
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel in a fantastic location, would definitely recommend it. The room was very nice and the bathroom was brand new. Both the room and bathroom were spotless. Will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Ok - nice place”
Reviews.Author: sere1977
Reviews.Content: hotel is in a very nice and convenient place near Latin area (where you can find plenty of restaurants). 5 min walk from notre dame. the breakfast is ok but I would have liked to have more choices, e.g more type of croissants, biscuits, cakes (none...) (breakfast costs 11 euro extra). the room is not very big but comfortable. overall a good choiche if you spend few days in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A great find”
Reviews.Author: Lesley200836
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our stay here. The staff were friendly and helpful, room was very clean and the hotel is in a great location. We particularly enjoyed the abundance of restaurants and bars in the locality and the fact that everything was within walking distance. We would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff, not so great rooms”
Reviews.Author: Tomochan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at room 307 for four nights early December. It was a twin with a view of the lovely church! The location can't be beat. It's 10 minutes to Notre Dame, 5 minutes to the Pantheon and about 25 min. walk to the Louvre. I really loved the Charcuterie St. Germaine and the Fromager right as you come out of the Maubert metro station. Eric Kayser boulanger was awesome for breakfast and treats for afternoon snack. The front desk staff members were always friendly, polite and professional. I really love everything about this place except for the beds. The twin beds were smallest I've ever seen. The width of the bed was the same width as my pillow. If I was any taller, I think my feet would be hanging out. I didn't have any issues with the bathroom, the heater or any other facilities. Unless you sleep like you're in a coffin, avoid booking the twin. We booked a shuttle for 17 Euro each to go to CDG. It took about 45 minutes to get there, but we also picked up several passengers along the way.

Reviews.Title: “Charming little neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: drJennyB
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying at this hotel, which is situated in a lovely part of the Latin Quarter. Only a short walk from the Notre Dame, this area is full of lovely bakeries, creperies and little boutiques. We ate breakfast at the Eric Kayser bakery each morning. The staff at the hotel were lovely. They allowed us to check in two hours early so that we could sleep after our long flight from NYC. The room was small but had modern fittings throughout. We were situated on the 1st floor overlooking the courtyard - great because we could walk the stairs to our room but not so great for the noise we could hear from upstairs rooms (like when someone had a bath at 2:30am!). We got a good deal on this hotel by booking directly through the hotel website. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Sensational”
Reviews.Author: Enchanted_Bella
Reviews.Content: I stumbled across this hotel due to some really great reviews - and this hotel really delivered. The staff were really friendly and helpful. I arrived early in the morning from an international flight, and they managed to have my room ready by 10am (WITHOUT me even requesting an early check-in - they just did it!!!). Good variety of food for breakfast (quite unusual for Paris!!)... Great location - so close to Notre Dame - close to the Metro, and all great cafes along Blvd St Germain. Would defiantely recommend this hotel to anyone and stay here again on future visits!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hillhouse
Reviews.Content: Couldn't have been more pleased. Ideally located, clean, friendly. Small rooms - but who wants to stay in the room when in Paris ?

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: jack_sparrow962
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed at the agora last september. The hotel is very well decorated and situated. Rooms are clean and the staff was polite and friendly! We look forward to our visit next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great location & good value for money”
Reviews.Author: headintheclouds08
Reviews.Content: The Agora is a great little hotel. It is very central but on a quiet street. I got exactly what I expected and a more. It is newly decorated with a more modern décor than some other Paris 3 star hotels. The staff was super friendly and helpful. The beds were comfortable. For a Paris 3 star hotel I really can’t fault it. Notre Dam is a stroll away; the Metro is nearby as are some good restaurants and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Very Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: SHE53
Reviews.Content: This was our third time to Paris and the Agora Saint Germain was a wonderful choice in the Latin Quarter. Kayer bakery is just around the corner as is Victor Cafe for great beef bourgione. The location is just off St. Germain within easy walking distance to the Notre Dame cathedral. On the weekend there is a wonderful open air market within two blocks. Very easy metro stop as well. The staff was most helpful with restaurant reservations, Moulin Rouge reservations and a shuttle to the airport on the day of our departure. There is a cathedral one block away and the bells do chime on the hour. This can be a little bothersome, but not a real problem. The elevator is small but very wonderful as some Paris hotels do not have elevators. I reviewed this hotel before booking and the reviews were all very right on and most helpful. I would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beware Non-Smokers!”
Reviews.Author: geordieal
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Agora for 2 nights over her birthday. Location and staff we could not fault. We had 2 great meals within 5 minutes walking distance from the front door and there is also a lovely wine shop just around the corner next to the Metro. The rooms were adequately sized and nicely decorated, our issue was with the fact that none of them were classed as "non-smoking" despite that being an option on the website we booked through. As a result we had to stay our first night in a room which STANK of stale cigarette smoke as there were no other available rooms. The chap on reception very kindly moved us on the 2nd night and we had a much nicer smelling room but you could still tell it had been smoked in. Why some of the rooms are not just designated as smoking rooms I don't know like every other hotel. PEOPLE WHO DO NOT SMOKE DO NOT WANT TO PAY TO SLEEP IN A ROOM WHICH SMELLS OF IT!! Either that or it should be made very clear on both the hotel website and to the booking websites.

Reviews.Title: “A Tough Time at the Agora”
Reviews.Author: SundayRiver2u
Reviews.Content: I spend a lot of time in Paris so I'm used to small rooms, but the one at the Agora was not only small, but hot and too noisy to open the window, which overlooked a dark, dank courtyard. The walls were painfully thin and noise from other rooms echoed in the courtyard, so I could hear a neighbor coughing, burping, and allowing other random bodily functions to reveberate throughout the silo of the courtyard. The bedspread was stained, the carpet was stained, the towels were old, rough and scarce - no wash clothes. There also was no safety chain or bolt on the door, and the key confounded me on every occasion. Just a pain to deal with. Internet was extremely expensive so I didn't use it. I loved the staff, they were absolutely wonderful, the location was great, the breakfast was tasty, but I was thankful to be leaving after 2 nights and I really can't recommend this hotel to anyone. I'm disappointed about this because the staff really was terrific and the one saving grace of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Super for visit Paris”
Reviews.Author: hrom
Reviews.Content: This hotel perfectly gave us all needs what we expect for our trip. Hotel is perfectly located, we were in hard of old town, around thousands of restaurands and bars are ready to spend our time with pleasure. It is only one, what is not like at home - too soft mattress and one cover for our couple, but we know that this is standard in western Europe and maybe we are strange that we need something else.

Reviews.Title: “The Agora was a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: skeeny
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely six day stay at the Agora Saint Germain! The hotel was located within walking distance of Notre Dame, and situated in a very nice neighborhood with a delicious bakery right around the corner for a morning coffee and croissant. The staff spoke English, and they were very helpful with all of our questions and requests. The room was very clean and comfortable, and the bathroom was newly remodeled. My only complaint would be that stepping out of the tub/shower was a very long step. However, that would not be enough to keep me away. I would definitely return to the Agora in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Taste the Paris charme”
Reviews.Author: PhF007
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel in Quartier Latin. I had a (very clean yet small as often the case in Paris) room on the street side giving view to a nice church. felt like Paris! Nice personel. All good! Walking distance to Notre Dame.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SFTraveler031
Reviews.Content: Perfect location (good neighborhood, restaurants and Metro nearby), smallish room but extremely clean and good bathroom. My only complaint is that the A/C wasn't working (they instead provided a small portable unit) and due to city noise (and the church bells!) you had to have your windows closed. If we had been in Paris when it was hot this unit wouldn't have provided enough cool air in order to sleep. Management must have known about the problem with the room (an upgraded room that we paid for) or else they wouldn't have provided the stand-alone unit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: TrvlBugAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location on a quiet street but only a few blocks to the metro, Notre Dame, St Germain, and a great bakery! The room was a little small but had all of the ammenities, was clean, and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: scooterbug
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I recently spent 3 days in Paris. We had a very pleasant stay at the Agora St. Germain Hotel. First, it appeared from the reviews and what I have been told that hotel rooms in Paris are small. This was my first trip to Paris so I'm not sure how to compare our room with others. The room was neat, clean and nicely decorated although, as I said, on the small side. The room had a desk, television and nightstands. The beds were very comfortable. The bathroom was actually large by comparison, although I think that we had the largest bathroom on the floor. I did reserve the "basic" room and there are more deluxe rooms available. The front desk was very helpful. It looked like the inside of the hotel had recently been redone and was very pleasant. There was a small but nice sitting area in the foyer. Of note, the church around the corner rings bells at about 8 every morning - however, there is so much to do in Paris we were up anyway! The location was perfect - a 3-minute walk from a metro stop, a 10 minute walk to Notre Dame, many, many excellent restaurants within walking distance and the greatest Bakery (Boulangerie Kayser) around the corner. This hotel is in the Latin Quarter. I had looked at several hotels more in the Saint Germain neighborhood (fancier); however, I'm glad we stayed here - it felt like staying in a small Parisian neighborhood slightly away from all the bustle of Saint Germain but easily within walking distance of everything. Overall, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “nice clean quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: gregd
Reviews.Content: very good business class hotel in good location. an excellent value

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Agora”
Reviews.Author: AuroraZoomer
Reviews.Content: Excellent location ,close to all transportation especially the subway system which is very good for getting anywhere in the city you could possibly wish to go. Staff at the Agora very friendly, helpfull, and spoke English so well you would think it was there first language !! The hotel is kept in a good clean condition .My wife and I would not hesitate to use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: alzadjalia
Reviews.Content: The location was excellent. Very close to the latin quarter and Notre Dame where you can catch the tour buses and all other transportation. The rooms were clean but a bit hot and small. The AC didn't seem to work very well. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. I enjoyed my stay at Agora St Germain overall and I am likely to return to stay there if I visit Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: beantown_illini
Reviews.Content: The best part of this hotel is the location, right in the heart of the Latin Quarter. Lots of tourist attractions are within walking distance, including the Louvre, Notre Dame, Pantheon, Sorbonne and rue Mouffetard. There are also numerous great restaurants and cafes nearby, and the metro is close, too. All in all, the location really can’t be beat. Our twin room (#19) was quite tiny, though I suppose the norm by European standards. Still, we weren’t even able to open the small closet without first moving the nightstand next to one of the beds, which was a bit of a nuisance. The bathroom was clean with a larger than expected bath/shower. The hairdryer looked like some sort of odd vacuum contraption, though, and blew out such little air that it took forever to dry our hair. Recommend packing your own. We never needed to request a wake-up call as there’s a church at the end of the street and we heard church bells throughout the day and night. It wasn’t terribly obnoxious, but it quickly became less charming and more annoying. My reviews on the staff are mixed. The woman who is at the desk during the day is very pleasant and helpful. The one time we asked for dinner recommendations, though, she gave us a card for a place around the corner and noted that it was open on Sundays, which it wasn’t – not a big deal, though. However, the man on duty at night is a lot less friendly and a lot less helpful. Our first night there, we returned after a fairly late night out and were somewhat alarmed to find him sleeping on the bare floor behind the desk! He jumped up, clearly startled, when we came in. Very strange! Also, we requested a cab to the airport very early in the morning the day we checked out and specifically requested ahead of time a cab that would accept a credit card. Asking for this in advance was useless, as the guy at the desk simply went outside and asked the cab driver if he took credit cards after he arrived, which he didn’t. I could’ve done that myself. One other thing that I found bothersome is that the hotel requests that you leave the key with them any time that you leave the hotel. I’ve experienced this before in Europe but it’s a practise that I’m not comfortable with, so we didn’t abide by the “rule” and luckily were never asked for ours when we left. Overall our stay was fine and the location was great, but I’d likely opt for another hotel in the same area instead next time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: SkaterWisconsin
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris, we were only there for two days, so location was very important to us. The Latin Quarter was a fun place to stay, and we were within walking distance to everything we wanted to see. Our room was small compared to those in the United States, but it was very comfortable, clean, and quiet. The internet was also free, so that was a nice bonus. If you are interested in seeiing Paris in a different light, we took a bike tour with Bike About Tours and that was a great. We were also told we could have gotten our room cheaper if we would have contacted the hotel directly. This hotel is definetly a place we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and convenient”
Reviews.Author: JonRambo
Reviews.Content: Friendly, English speaking staff. Safe, quiet side street within walking distance of Notre-Dame but sufficiently away from the main tourist drag to have a interesting, authentic boulangerie, cafe etc Room and en-suite shower room were small, but modern, clean and with air conditioning and flat-screen TV. My room was quiet, but faced the back with no view. Try to either face the street or the internal courtyard garden. I'd be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I will recommend the Agora St Germain to any friends going to Paris”
Reviews.Author: LindaandJohn2
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Agora St Germain. The location is wonderful...right in the heart of everything and very convenient to the metro. We appreciated the free wifi. The price seemed reasonable for Paris. I'd return again. The staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, great location, great room!”
Reviews.Author: bristraveller
Reviews.Content: Had heard horror stories about Paris hotel rooms so I researched this one a lot. The hotel exceeded expectations. The room was renovated with a lovely bathroom, comfortable bed, and with a little lcd tv on the wall. The location was perfect - so close to the Notre-Dame. As this was our first trip to Paris, and we were only in the city for 2 days, we used the "hop-on-hop-off" red tourist bus as our public transport from the Notre-Dame and saved quite a bit of money this way. Would definately recommend the Agora Saint Germain.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for a left bank weekend”
Reviews.Author: MilesSouthofEngland
Reviews.Content: Very good basic hotel which proved more than adequate as a base for our weekend in Paris. Comfortable and clean room. Well equiped and clean bathroom. Air conditioned. Bonus of a small balcony. Velib station (Paris bike hire) just round the corner - very handy. Short walk to Metro. Easy walking distance to the Seine and Notre Dame. Ate breakfasts out so can't comment on quality or value of hotel breakfast. Reception staff speak good English if your French (like mine) isn't up to it. No complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Quite good hotel - Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: ICVVB
Reviews.Content: The hotel was quite good and the location magnificent. We booked a twin (double) room and stayed 5 nights. We got room 64 which was located on the 6th floor looking at the back alley of the hotel. As a result the room was very quiet (we did not even hear the bells of Saint-Nicolas du Chardonnet church which was located right opposite to the hotel - something that seemed to bother other reviewers in Trip Advisor). The bedroom had double-glazed windows and air-conditioning of a very good quality. The bedroom was relatively small but it was very clean and recently refurbished (note: not so small though by Paris or London standards). The bed mattress was excellent. The bathroom (with shower) was exceptionally clean, good in size and fully equipped. Service was excellent (we got in contact with five different employees at the reception - everyone of them spoke English and were very helpful) The location is magnificent to say the least. Very near there are shops, cafés, bistros, brasseries and restaurants etc. Also it is very near or near to Paris' main attractions (Notre Dame, the Louvre, Latin Quarter, Boulevard Saint-Germain, Muse d' Orsay, The Eiffel Tower etc.). There is an excellent boolangerie (bakery) only a few meters from the hotel (it is called Eric Kayser and is located at 8 rue Monge: turn left as you go out of the hotel and a few meters down turn left again and you are in rue Monge). It has excellent croissants and other goodies. Try a stroll through Rue des Ecoles [fist street as you turn right getting out of the hotel] - and try "La petite Périgourdine" on 39, Rue des écoles for some excellent and rather cheap French food - beware though the menu is only in French and written on a whiteboard). You can also try some of the numerous establishments found on the nearby Saint-Germain and Saint-Michel boulevards (most of them have English menus). For an excellent dinner at quite good prices you can try "Le Petit Prince de Paris" it is located at 12, Rue Lanneau (quite near to the hotel - 3 to 4 blocks away and off Rue des Ecoles - better to find it on a map though or at http://maps.google.com/). The metro stop is only two blocks away from the hotel (station Maubert - Mutualité at Boulevard Saint-Germain). Tickets can be used also at buses and RER trains cost: 1,60 Euro per ticket, but is a better idea either to buy a carnet of ten tickets at a price of about 11 euros (that is 1.1 per ticket) or even better to buy a Paris-visite card (unlimited travel for 1, 2, 3 or 5 days at 8,50 - 14 - 9 or 27,50 euros per person - see details at: http://www.ratp.info/informer/anglais/paris_visite.php All these tickets can be bought at all Metro stations (in every station there are employees where you can buy them - besides vending machines). Try to use the buses if you can (they have an excellent online system of letting you know the itineraries and the waiting time in every bus stop). Buses are quite fast and you can also see a lot of Paris by traveling on them. Otherwise try the Metro. In concluding we had a very comfortable stay, at a good price an in an a more than excellent location. I would strongly recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “A great little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Thormohlen
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel! My daughter and I spent five days there in June. The rooms, the hallways and the elevator are really small, but the location is great. Two blocks from Notre Dame! And it is close to two excellent bakeries. Also, there are two easy to use laundromats within a block of the hotel. Don't worry about the church bells, never a problem at night. The day staff is excellent! Don't hesitate to book this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nels1792
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Agora St Germain was a very nice Paris hotel. It was conveniently located to the Maubert Metro stop near Notre Dame in Latin Quarters and close to all our vacation requirements, including restaurants, stores and even local markets. The hotel staff was very helpful even with last minute changes to our stay. We stayed in two different rooms during two separate visits. The first room was small, but very clean and quiet; not on street side and thus no view. The second room was on the top floor; again very clean and did have a beautiful view of the neighborhood. It was noisy at night and in the morning, but personally I think it added to the experience. In other words, "good noise." We did not eat at the hotel, but did see the breakfast area and it looked very nice. For price and location, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My 5th time at this great little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Loves_to_travel_017
Reviews.Content: I first stayed at Agora St. Germain in 2002 and have stayed 4 times since. It is a block from Maubert-Mutualite Metro stop and easy walking distance to Notre Dame, Jardin du Luxembourg, and many other attractions. The street market is held twice a week right at the Metro and the shops for wine, cheese, meats, fish, fruits and vegetables are all in a line. Between the Metro and Agora is the #1 ranked boulangerie in Paris, Erik Kayser. As you walk from the Metro to the hotel you feel a sense of neighborhood as you join the line at Kayser's for your hot baguette or fruit tarte. The rooms are nicely decorated, comfortable beds and linens, flat-screen TV, and a newly-renovated bathroom -- all can been seen in the hotel website's picture gallery. The interior rooms with windows opening into a small interior courtyard are very, very quiet. For the past 2 1/2 years I have seen the same staff at the hotel and always greeted with a cheerful, "Bonjour." Each of the staff was helpful, courteous, and gracious. I highly recommend this hotel and will be back as soon as I can get to Paris again!

Reviews.Title: “Gets the job done”
Reviews.Author: sherlocks4
Reviews.Content: Overall, I would say if you are just looking for a place to sleep & shower, the hotel served its purpose - clean, quiet and comfortable with easy access to the metro. Once we got past the spartan interior, the overall hotel room was clean, the staff helpful and the beds comfortable. From what I understand the tight accomodations are par for the course in Europe offering two twin beds, shower over tub, etc. . The Boulangerie next door was awesome and provided a way to save on breakfast costs. However, I could do without the noisy student element and the dirty streets in the surrounding Latin Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Love the neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: TennesseeTraveler057
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in the Left Bank several times and by far the Agora St. Germain was the best. We would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a reasonably priced, comfortable, and friendly place to stay in the Latin Quarter. All of the staff persons were pleasant, helpful, and spoke English. We will likely stay there again the next time we're in Paris. The room was little larger than expected, nicely decorated, comfortable soft bed (we had two twins pushed together), and a good sized bathroom for the price. It's scale and location really make you feel like you're staying in a neighborhood. The Mutualite Maubert Metro is very convenient, as is the market and shops at Maubert, one of the Left Bank's better bakeries (that's saying something) is just around the corner, as are a small grocery and laundromat. Maybe a 8-10 leisurely walk to Notre Dame. Whereas some previous reviews mentioned the church bells, our window overlooked the church and the bells typically did not start until 8 and even then weren't that bad, rather atmospheric actually. Bottom line is if you understand the difference between a small well managed neighborhood hotel and one of the bigger boy chains, and you want the former, choosing the Agora is a good option.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small but adquate”
Reviews.Author: CultureVultureCamb
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located, clean and friendly. No real problems with the stay but the room was small even by Parisian standards - just enough around the side of the bed and it had a tiny wardrobe. Although worth noting that there was a mini-bar with space to keep our own drinks cool. Our room was on the ground floor, looking into the inner atrium and straight across to the reception and the street outside. There were curtains/blinds for privacy. Overall, the room was quite gloomy. Having said that it was very comfortable and quiet so we slept well and the bathroom was recently refurubished with good facilities organised into a small space. We didn't eat breakfast in the hotel as there was a great locals cafe a few steps away and this was one of many choices nearby. It was simple to find and walk from the metro and easy to walk to just about all the places we wanted to visit. I would probably stay again because the location was great and the staff were helpful. I'd make a point of asking the hotel for a better room - the tariff in the hotel itself has different rates for various rooms so it is possible that for a few euros more we could have had a better room (had they been available at the time of booking).

Reviews.Title: “2nd Stay in 3 months - as great as the first!”
Reviews.Author: Cweis
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Agora in early June, again on business in Paris. I'm pleased to report that my stay was as pleasant the second time as the first. The first time, I stayed on the 3rd floor in a double. This time I stayed on the 5th floor - and my room was exactly the same! Friendly staff, reasonable price, great location near Notre Dame and many other tourist sites. Great value for the money. The only difference is that they now offer complimentary internet.
