Sadly, the only English channels remain BBC and CNN News...but it is France so I suppose that's too much to hope for. I would definitely stay here again - either on business or hopefully when I'm able to return for a holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: CanadianTraveler17
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great - friendly staff, great location to subway, and really close to Notre Dame. As a single female traveler I felt really safe in the hotel and the surrounding area. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay there again. A minor problem was the air conditioner was leaking and the dripping was a bit noisy, however this was promised to be fixed.

Reviews.Title: “...not a stranger but a welcome guest ! or should I say......… pas un étranger m”
Reviews.Author: garlen
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was friendly and professional.They went out of their way to be helpful and to make one feel welcome and at ease.Our room was great...small but comfortable and not unexpected for Europe.Housekeeping was excellent!Loved the church bells,the balcony,location,location,location.I would stay there again in a minute and would reccomend to my friends and family.I want to return to France....et J'aime Paris et ses mercis de personnes… de tout !

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: BarnabyGidding
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two night break in Paris, staying at the Agora. I found the hotel on the Eurostar website and then looked at reviews on "tripadvisor". The reviews were good and the hotel didn't disappoint. We wanted friendly staff, a clean room and a location near the river. All the above were spot on. The river, with a breathtaking view across to Notre Dame was a brief ( approx 2min) stroll away. Very clean room- small but an excellent base. All the staff were helpful and friendly. We chose not to have breakfast in the hotel- more of a Paris experience to find one of the many cafes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: npacers04
Reviews.Content: Clean and modern, room was much larger than the average Paris hotel room, affable staff and great rate. I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just Right”
Reviews.Author: gao3
Reviews.Content: Have been back around 3 weeks and have been meaning to write. Stayed in this hotel based on reviews that we read and by location and price. We too were not disappointed. The location was perfect very deverse and with easy access to all that we wanted to do. The shops, cafes, street market and metro are all within walking distance as was the seine and all the attractions around it. All the little streets were wonderful and made you feel more like a local than a tourist which was what we wanted.Took the eurostar to London and a day trip to Giverney, both were a great experience. The room was small, as expected, but perfect for us and was kept neat and clean, the staff was pleasant. We enjoyed having a balcony and we found the church bells charming and not bothersome at all. Also pictures we found posted on this site are exactly what it is like. Had a great time and would easily go back and stay there again (tommorrow would not be to soon!)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: travellerJack
Reviews.Content: The good: - location is wonderful, very convenient to the major attractions of Paris, a 10-minute walk from Notre Damme or the Pantheon, surrounded by hundreds of cafes, bars and restaurants. Nearest metro is 100 meters away, just around the corner. And several bus lines run on St Germain and Rue des Ecoles, around the corner. - Very clean. The corridors and rooms have a fresh smell, rooms are made daily and housekeeping standards are perfect. - Bathroom: while small, it was great. Power shower with a strong stream of hot water (Grohe!); modern amenities; new, thick, fresh-smelling towels (replaced daily). - Personnel: everybody was friendly and helpful. Front desk staff extremely helpful, they made several phone calls for us, booked restaurants, confirmed reservations, checked flight departure times, everything. Housekeeping staff friendly and cheerful. - Breakfast: was included in our rate, and consisted of excellent bread and croissants, good cheese, very good coffee and juice, and some extras we didn't need. The not-so-good: - It's a small room. And a small bathroom. No bidet, if you need one (but there's a hair dryer). - It's expensive. Not more expensive than other 3* establishments in Paris, most of which are much poorer. But still, 170-180 Euro a night for a double is a lot of money. The bad: - nothing, really.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: vacances04
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the comments that I read from Trip Advisor and I was not disappointed. The hotel web site is very representative of the hotel and our room was exactly as the photos and it was kept very clean. Yes, the rooms were very small, but we had every convenience that we could want. We were on the first floor with a nice window looking out onto the church.The neighbourhood was not in the highest tourist area, and you were able to get a feel for the local comings and goings. It was noisy in the daytime with the window open, but we did not spend much time in our room.The church across the street was charming, especially with the church bells waking you each morning! The location was perfect and everything was within walking distance from tourist attractions, local markets, great shopping and fabulous restautants. We did not take the breakfast in the hotel. There was a fabulous bakery just next door (Kayser bakery) and the croissants, pain au chocolat and cheese bread were amazing. The local brasserie (Brasserie Barnum) was serving everything from breakfast to lunch, dinner and the most amazing creme brulée. Everywhere we went the service was very friendly. The staff at the Hotel Agoral Saint Germain were very friendly and consistently provided great directions and recommendations for dining. Le Petit Pontpoise was definately a memorable dining experience, not to mention Toustem and Le Buisson Ardent. Coming from Montreal, we had high expectations and were not disappointed. Expensive mind you but worth every morsel. It was a most enjoyable sejour in Paris and I would definately stay at Hotel Agora Sainmt Germain again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect little hotel in Latin Qtr”
Reviews.Author: susanlubbers
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased w/ the Agora St Germain, great location in the Latin Qtr just off Blvd St Germain, walking distance to river/Notre Dame. Recently renovated rooms, nice bathrooms, very clean, small as I expected but very comfortable and quiet. Staff was very helpful. You must get a baguette from the little bakery on Rue Monge around the corner, best in town! Overall it was completely worth every penny I spent and found it very reasonable compared to other places I researched.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Laura-GoingPlaces
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a weekend break with my boyfriend. I decided on on this hotel because of the location and reviews. What can I say, it was perfect! Rue des Bernardins (the street on which the hotel is situated) takes you straight down to the Seine and the Notre Dame. We used the Batobus to navigate the city and there is a stop at the Notre Dame which was so convenient. We took the boat to the Champs Elysees and walked to the Eiffel Tower (although you can take the boat directly to the Eiffel Tower if you wish). The St Germain area is great with loads of different cafes, bars and shops within walking distance. We came across Tunisian, Japanese, Greek, Indian, Thai, Chinese, Vietnamese, Turkish and of course French cuisine all in the vicinity. There are also designer clothes shops close by for those who can afford it (window shopping only for me!). Our room at the hotel was very modern, clean and comfortable. The minibar is reasonably priced (for a minibar in Paris) and contains a range of soft drinks. I don't know if our room was well sound proofed or the guests were quiet because we didn't hear a peep the whole time. There are TVs in the room with a small range of European channels and CNN and BBCWorld for the English speaking, not that a TV is needed whatsoever as we really only used the room to sleep. We had breakfast at the hotel once and it was fine, a normal continental breakfast as you would expect. We tended to visit the many patisseries, boulangeries and delis in the area! The staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful. People said before we went that we would find french people rude, but this is rubbish. Even though we spoke little of their language we found that everyone appeared kind and patient (bar 1 moody woman who worked at the metro station in Marne la Valee). I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone, I couldn't fault it in anyway. Paris is definately one of the most beautiful cities I have ever seen and I will go back one day.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Agora St. Germain”
Reviews.Author: Azhan
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 4 night stay at the Agora St. Germain. We were very pleased with the hotel. The location was fantastic, very central, close to most of the neighborhoods, metro and RER train station and in a less touristy area. (which we always prefer). We were amazed with how quiet it was considering it is in a fairly busy area. There was also an excellent bakery and patisserie right around the corner where we had breakfast and bought bread for our picnics on the Seine (only a few blocks away). The hotel front desk even had a cork screw to open the wine we bought for the picnic! Everyone on the staff was very helpful and friendly. The room was clean , nicely decorated, and well kept by the housekeeping staff. It was also well laid out for a typical smaller sized European room with big closets on each side of the bed. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “A Gem”
Reviews.Author: Traci_and_Stuart
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights on a Paris get-away using a EuroStar package. The rooms clean and nicely finished, the staff were very pleasant and helpful and the location was wonderful, a short walk to Notre Dame, close to the metro, and good restaurants. We had a fantastic dinner at the nearby La Meree Verte. I absolutely will recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: selphy
Reviews.Content: We had quite high expectations due to the rave reviews previous visitors had posted, however we were quite disappointed with our stay at Hotel Agora St Germain. There were serious renovations being undertaken while we were there which no one advised us of- (painting, which stank out the whole floor- , floor coverings removed, doors removed, drilling and constant noise)- and even a tradesman who came into our room for 15 minutes without asking, to change the door lock- while we were resting in there!), the hairdryer was broken, the shower did not have a head which could be attached to the wall, making it impossible to wash your hair, and the constant entering of the maids without knocking became really annoying. When we politely approached the desk staff, they were unresponsive. When we asked for a reccommendation on somewhere to eat (traditional, simple, french) they sent us to a gross hollywood themed bar. The location is good- but there are plently of other hotels in the area i would stay at next time instead.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay at the Agora”
Reviews.Author: linkSuffolk
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a three night stay at the Agora St Germain. The hotel is in a pleasant location and only a short walk from the metro. The hotel itself is clean and well kept and we had no complaints about the standard of the rooms. The beds were comfortable but you could tell they were well slept in, clean linen but the bedspeads looked a little tired. Generally the furnishings were fine however. The bathroom was lovely but my mums was older and needed updating. One thing I would recommend is to make sure that you do not get a room overlooking the rather dingy courtyard as there is no view at all and the rooms are very dark. My daughter and I had a room on the outside on the 6th floor and the view was nice and typical of Paris. We went round the corner to a small bar and had delicious coffee and croissants for half the price of the hotel breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience for insomniacs!”
Reviews.Author: Fresiandaniels
Reviews.Content: This hotel always seems to get great reviews. It is both value for money and benefits from wonderfully helpful staff. It is off a main road, so slightly protected from Parisienne traffic noises although it is close to a popular church which gives you no peace whatsoever with loud bell ringing sessions. The rooms are pretty small but refurbished and whilst the bedrooms are pretty middle of the road, the bathrooms have been given a pleasant modern twist. However, beware being allocated a room at the rear of the hotel. These look out on the blank wall of an internal well shaft, so absolutely no views and the rooms are dark as a result. Noise tends to travel up the well. You are shielded from the city noises of the front facing rooms though. All rooms have a problem of paper-thin walls, so if you don't mind hearing your neighbours ' baby crying all night or early morning drinking sessions as friends catch up on their days out - this is for you. It is a great area for food - brilliant boulangeries/cheese shops, restaurants and cafes and it is literally 5 minutes from Notre Dame and the Panthenon. All in all a good experience if you are not looking for pampering or a night's sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: balletbotox
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 7 nights this past April. I would consider staying here again. The location was the best. It was conveniently located near the metro. There was also a street market near the hotel that was quite fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: snrpublic
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel as part of a mid-week break to Paris. I used Tripadvisor to pick a Hotel and travelled on the Eurostar. It was cheaper to book direct rather than as part of a Eurostar package. Bedrooms very clean with good bathroooms. Hotel location is just brilliant, being minutes from the Boulevard St Germain and the Ile de la Cite. Fairly small rooms which is typical of a boutique-style hotel but you are only there to sleep right? What really made it for me was the helpful attitude of all the staff. Everyone made us feel very welcome and they were always eager to help, which has not always been my experience of Parisians to the 'rosbifs!' Make the effort to speak some French and you will be well rewarded! Lots of places to eat and drink nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SuzieIreland
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Agora for three nights the start of March and must say I was very impressed with the hotel.. They were renovating the corridors when we were there so things looked a bit messy, we don't spend much time in corridors so we didn't let that upset us too much!!!!! :-) Rooms were small but perfectly formed, I think when your in Paris you don't spend too much time in them... The best thing about the Agora is it's location you can walk to many of the major tourist sights without too much stress.. Metro is really convenient and must say very easy to work out even for me!!! We had breakfast included in our package but as others have said this is 11 euros, I don't think it would be worth it so if your paying for it you might want to think about not including this.. Reception staff were always very pleasant only people we found a little bit rude were the kitchen staff at breakfast.. Only a small complaint, would definatley recommend the Agora and will definatley visit again..

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed”
Reviews.Author: bb1976
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel cos it got such a high rating on tripadvisor and are glad we did. The room was very good and the hotel was in an excellent location. Our room was small but had enough storage space that it didn't seem cramped, was very chic and completely spotless. I've stayed in higher star-rated hotels that have had worse rooms. Our room overlooked the courtyard, so didn't have much light, but also no traffic or church bells noise. That said, we could hear quite a lot of noises from the rest of the hotel. The hotel is also undergoing refurbishment, so the corridors were 'works in progress'. The bed was very comfortable and we had the smallest bath in the world in our room, but at least it was a bath! Staff were very helpful. The location really made the Agora, it was within seconds of the metro and minutes of the Seine and Notre Dame (and the RER). What's more, all the little cafes and restaurants locally were great for breakfast or a nightcap. The Latin Quarter was our favourite arrondisement and seemed slightly cheaper than the rest of paris. The Metro is excellent and so fast and the RER is even faster, if a little less attractive. You're not really in Paris to stay in a hotel room, but if you choose the Agora, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Gerry_Ryan
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 3 night stay in Paris and a 3 night stay in the Agora Saint Germain. Unless you go luxury, nearly all hotel rooms in Paris are tiny, however this is an exception. While not huge, the rooms did afford a little walking space between the bed and the wall. Bathroom was small, but again, a little bigger than most hotels I've stayed with in Paris. But the main reason you should chose this hotel is location. It is in the Latin Quarter about a 5 minute walk from Notre Dame. Back behind the hotel (another 5 minute walk away) are all the bars and restaurants that make up The Latin Quarter. We ate here a few times and most of the restaurants are pretty reasonable and serve good food. There is a great vibe around this area, which is full of students having a few drinks. The hotel was being renovated when we were there, mainly aesthetics, paint work etc., but there was no noise at all at night or early morning. We had breakfast on one morning and it was fine, pain au chocolate and croissants. One person did ask for the bacon and eggs (that was advertised), but was met with a very curt, c'est fini. The only complaint I would have about this hotel is that there are no hooks on the back of the bathroom door to hang your towel and if that's all there is to complain about, then it must be good. If you are flying into Paris and staying here, take the train from CDG to St. Michel Notre Dame, then look for the Orange coloured line 10 (about a 2 minute walk), which will bring you to Cluny La Sarbonne and from there, it's just one stop up to Maubert Mutualite. Hotel is about a 2 minute walk from the Metro (it's easier to ask when you get there, rather than me trying to explain it). If I was going back to Paris, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: suefrombrooklyn
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Agora Saint Germain. It is a lovely little hotel in a fantastic location. The rooms and lobby are very clean. I stayed for 4 nights. On my first night, I had a room on the first floor that faced a courtyard. There was no light. I asked to be moved and the next day, a room on the 4th floor with a picturesque view of a church was made available. The room was a bit smaller (hard to imagine since all the rooms are small), but the light and air made all the difference. Waking up to a view outside your window really makes the trip special, notwithstanding the church bells ringing every hour or so. The breakfast does not come with the room. I didn't know that until after the fact. At 11 euros, it is not cheap. There are croissants, bread, cheese, yoghurt, hard-boiled eggs, cereal, juice, coffee. Everything was very good and very fresh. If you don't want to think about breakfast, and money is not an issue, the breakfast is the way to go. Around the corner and in the neighborhood are plenty of places to go for breakfast if you want to venture out. The hotel recommended several good places nearby to dine for dinner. I especially liked the husband/wife team at La Maree Verte. They don't speak English, but, are lovely hosts. The hotel is undergoing renovation. The hallways are being painted and are a mess. Each weekday morning, plastic is laid down on the carpeted floors and each evening, the plastic is lifted and the floors vacuumed. Even still, there is plaster dust in the halls. The renovations did not interfere with my use of the room. When in Paris, who spends time in their room? If you are someone who hangs around the hotel during the day, you may want to wait a few weeks (until the end of January 2008) to stay in the hotel. Otherwise, I whole-heartedly recommend the hotel to anyone looking for a quaint small hotel in a great neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: bellagirl11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Agora in early January 2008. The hotel is in a brilliant location - a couple of hundred metres from a metro stop, a bakery, cheese shop, wine shop, green grocers... and only a few blocks from Notre Dame. The room was small (as all are in Paris), but had everything that we needed in it - a tv with BBC World, good heating and a small fridge. The hotel was in the midst of renovations, and our bathroom had clearly only been done recently, as it was all very clean and shiny. The only issue was that the water temperature in the shower was not hot enough (the cold tap didn't work, so I guess they set the temperature low so that no one gets burnt).

Reviews.Title: “perfect!”
Reviews.Author: cgonsal
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at Hotel Agora St. Germain mid-December 2007. Our room was on the 4th floor facing the street.There is a lift which was a great asset. Opening the french windows in our room, we could see to the left a church and to the right the Palais de la Mutualite. The room was smallish but not a problem. We had plenty of storage space and room to move around. There was a flat screen TV on the wall, the bed linens were clean and fresh and the room really was delightful. The bath was very modern and clean with a shower in a tub so splashing was minimized. Absolutely no complaints about the room which provided all toiletries as well as a hair dryer. I would recommend a street side room for the view and the ambience. The hotel is right off of rue Monge and a couple of blocks up from Blvd. St. Germain. The back of Notre Dame is about two blocks away. We did not have the breakfast at the hotel which charged 11 euros per person, rather we walked out the door and within 1 block there are a number of patisseries to choose from for either a continental breakfast or simply a hot drink and pastry--all much more reasonable than 11 euros. We took the Metro everywhere, using the nearest station which is Maubert-Mutualite. Very convenient for all of our sight-seeing. We ate at several restaurants within walking distance and all were good. One, Pescatore (located at 28 rue des Ecoles), served an excellent meal and , wherever we went, we were always able to get a "formule" dinner of an entre, main course and dessert for between 11 and 15 euros each. We did eat big bowls of onion soup one evening on Champs Elysees and then another evening we ate in the Montmarte district. We enjoyed a local Parisian market one morning on Blvd. St. Germain near the Maubert-Mutualite Metro station and another morning the market was near the Cardinal Lemoine Metro station on rue Monge. I would definitely recommend this hotel. We spent 130 euros per night which may seem expensive but not considering our location and the current unfortunate value of the dollar. Being in Paris during the Christmas season was absolutely wonderful. The huge Christmas tree in front of Notre Dame, the spectacular blue lights decorating the trees lining both sides of Champs Elysees and all of the florists with Christmas arrangements, small pine trees and other holiday offerings. Additionally there were few people at the Louvre (we have a picture of one of the galleries with one person standing in it) and the longest wait we had for anything was 30 minutes to take the elevator at the Eiffel Tower. Otherwise, essentially there were no crowds of tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Excellent Staff, Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: EA
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Hotel Agora Saint Germain Dec 9 -13 and really appreciated the size of our room, cleanliness and location for a reasonable price. We paid 111 euros/night. Compared to our crappy hole in the wall London accommodations, Hotel Agora was the Ritz. The hotel is right around the corner from a bakery, wine cellar, fromager and Maubert Metro station. We loved the Metro - quick and easy to navigate.The hotel staff is excellent, they all speak English impeccably - wish I knew French as well. We received the best restaurant advice every day from the front desk. There was construction in the atrium when we were there, which was quite noisy one morning, but other than that I have no complaints. Will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Tristans_friend
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my significant other during the Paris riots, so it was exciting for us to see, on the night we arrived, a student protest happening right around the corner, complete with vans and vans of riot police cordoning off the area (which we thought was overkill). Ambience plus! The hotel itself is in an old building but refurbished. Rooms are small - or standard in French hotels/ B&Bs - and clean, with brand new bathrooms and nice fresh bedding, as someone else pointed out. We booked via the hotel's website and got a deluxe room for 109 euro a night, then moved to a standard room (which was larger and better, imo) on the last night for 99 euro - excellent value. Yes, the church bells do go off a lot and the rooms and corridors smell of smoke, but this is just a part of the Paris experience. The hotel was close to the Latin Quarter, Notre Dame and plenty of restaurants and bistros. Internet was pay-as-you-go (but for our short stints online we tapped into someone else's wifi, which was free), plus the shower was strong and hot (mind the run-off) and the room was very warm, so we kept the French doors ajar in the night. Reception seemed friendly enough, and apart from the maid letting herself into the room one morning, we have no complaints. Hotel Alba also looked good - we saw it on our walks through the area - but I think we got better value.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Alexxsandra
Reviews.Content: I'm extremely fussy when it comes to cleanliness and hygiene standards and this hotel fortunately ticked all the boxes: clean towels, bedding, room and bathroom! Also a great safe location for single travellers, hotel staff friendly and helpful. Would definitely not recommend as I plan to be a frequent visitor of Paris in 2008 and don't want to find the hotel full when I need a room :o)

Reviews.Title: “Good Place!”
Reviews.Author: uncleroyhobbs
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 11/15-11/23/07 during the transportation strike. Good hotel, good location, nice people & good prices. Post any questions you may have for specifics. Note: an American Breakfast in Paris (Roadside Diner) is about a block away in case you get homesick for American coffee ("a bottom cup of joe") or tosted bagel with Phili cream cheese. Very nice servers here, from Canada. Our departure cab already had $11.50 euros on the meter when they picked us up...thought that was too much! Taxi fare at seven (7) am with NO Traffic to CDG was $60.00 euros (with no tip and he didn't get one either). In general, a good time!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Gottahavemycuppajoe
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel because is it located in the same neighborhood in which we lived back in 2001, so it was a little like "coming home." We arrived by train from Florence (another review on that!), so we actually took the bus to get to the hotel, which was just fine. Hotel was very nice; staff was very friendly and helpful. No Internet access available, though (no big deal as by this time, we didn't want to check e-mail!). Breakfast was good, not perfect, but okay--we missed the baguette, so having this as part of the breakfast was great! Hotel room was small, but okay. Bathroom was smal, but that was okay, too. Both were clean so that was very important to us. Location again was excellent--within walking distance of the Seine, Notre Dame, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location...”
Reviews.Author: shawnus
Reviews.Content: A FEW WORDS to describe why I loved this hotel: small, cozy, immaculate, warm, friendly, helpful, stylish and above all - well situated for the tourist who likes to see things on foot. Nice enough to be a notch above the other gazillion budget hotels in Paris, but small enough to make you feel comfortable and at ease during your stay. SOME GREAT, UNEXPECTED features of the room included high thread count, awesomely comfortable bed linens and a firm Sealy quality mattress. Each side of the double bed (Room 68) had two, super fluffy pillows per person. The AC and heat (radiator) worked very well and the room never felt stuffy as the large double windows could be fully opened onto the street. THIS HOTEL MAKES a superb base for seeing the sights of Paris. With two close Metro stops, an RER stop and a short stroll to the Ile-de-la-Cite you will feel like you're really in the hub of things. WHILE THERE WASN'T much to detract from the overall high marks I'd give this place I would add the following... I wouldn't suggest paying for the hotel breakfast. At 11 Euros it's a joke. Go around the corner (out of the hotel, a left and then another left) and you will immediately find at least 2 places more reasonably priced. Also, even if your room is non-smoking (I'm not sure that there are any) you will smell smoke from other guests' rooms as the hotel is very small. The elevator is a 2 person ride, but the spiral stairs were convenient when there was too long of a wait. The church bells across the street will wake you up, but I found this to be a pleasant experience - much better than the "waa-waa-waa" of an alarm clock anyway. The shower-only setup in room 68 was less than satisfactory. With roughly 4 square feet to maneuver, no splash guards of any sort and super slick marble-printed ceramic tile taking a shower was an adventure. It was dangerous - and I'm young. EATING OUT SUGGESTIONS in close proximity to the hotel include a great Indian restaurant called the Bollywood Lounge, Cafe du Pont Neuf, the Kayser bakery and the multi-function, smallish cafe/bar next door to the Kayser. Breakfast there was 6.50 Euros for 1 croissant, 1 orange juice and 1 coffee of your choice. At night it was a great place to get a drink after being out all day - relaxed, never crowded with friendly employees (as long as you make an effort at speaking French; it seems to be the key everywhere though - especially if you're American). MOST OF THE pics for this review are labeled "Room 68".

Reviews.Title: “A little Gem”
Reviews.Author: MsRM
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is lovely. The staff are friendly (the front desk open 24hrs) and the decor very elegant without being overdone. The room was clean and tidy and the decor is modern. We had a standard room. The rooms are not big but fine and there was a small wardrobe if you plan a longer stay (we stayed only 1 night). we had room 69. it is on the top story and overlooked the street and other buildings in the area. The images on their website are accurate as to what you get, so only pleasant suprises. The only downside was the elevator was broken when we arrived from a long walk with all our luggage. So we carried it 6 flights. it was repaierd overnight so that was a relief! the breakfast was nice too, usual french fare- coffee/tea,croissants, cheeses, jams ,yoghurt, bread, boiled egg, cereal etc. Convenient location. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: AmeMar
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 9 nights in September and was incredibly pleased. For 169 euros a night, we got a lovely small room looking onto the street with double french doors that could open. The bathroom was tiny, but newly done over and had everything we needed. What I actually want to mention is the staff. Aline, Eric, Raynard were all extremely helpful. They assisted us to check train schedules, directes us where ever we wanted to go, made and cancelled reservations for us and never once gave us the impression that is was a drag for them. The front desk is manned 24 hours a day and the night staff were always quick to respond and friendly (even in the dead of night). The only problem we had was a bit of noise from the street at night, but if you can bear to close the french doors, you will not have the same problem. Great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: RSXM
Reviews.Content: We stayed here four nights and we will stay again when we next visit Paris. The location is great: a very short walk to Notre Dame Cathedral, the Pantheon, restaurants on Blvd. St. Germain and the Seine. The staff was very helpful and friendly, the hotel was immaculate and the room was new and comfortable. We had read other reviews mentioning the small size of the rooms and elevator and were prepared for the worst, but we found the room to be of average size and the elevator accomodated us quite nicely. Breakfasts were ample and of good quality, served in a lovely room on the floor below the lobby. We were pleased with every aspect of our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: rain7198
Reviews.Content: My extended family (10 of us in all) stayed here for 4 nights and it was wonderful. From check in to check out the staff was friendly and helpful (even though between the 10 of us we speak almost no french). The tiny elevator added to the romance of the surroundings, and the lobby was an fine meeting place for us. my wife and I stayed in room 38 and had a great view of the church across the street. Having been warned about the small rooms, we were pleasantly suprised with being able to walk all around the bed, and plenty of room to store our luggage and accumulated shopping bags! The small cafe around the corner serves amazing croissants and cafe, and there are cute shops nearby, including a toy store we bought gifts to bring home for our kids. As noted Notre Dame, the Pantheon are both a few blocks away, and we walked to the Louvre, Orsey, and Pompadou. Not short walks, but lots to see along the way. My wife and I had to catch a 6:50 am plane on our return, meaning leaving the hotel at 4:15am. Our wakeup call came at the correct time, and the taxi was waiting when we got downstairs. This was my first time in Paris, and I will definately be visiting again, and staying at This hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect miracles”
Reviews.Author: MonikafromSurrey
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights with my Mum in early October. I had booked a twin room with breakfast via a travel agent. When we arrived the receptionist surprised us saying that they ran out of twin rooms and could offer us only a double room. We were willing to pay for an upgrade but all rooms had been taken. It wasn't a great start. The room was a shoe box size and smelt heavily of cigarette smoke. Luckily, the house-keeping was quick to react and in the evening when we came back, it was all fresh and pleasant. The best part of our double room was the bathroom. It was clean and modern although "petit". The reception staff was always very friendly and happily offered advice on how to use public transport and taxis. Breakfast was also sufficient with a reasonable selection of pastries and bread and rolls. The cheese board was OK. We loved the location and proximity to a Metro station, lots of shops (bakery, grocery shop, cheese shop, etc) and more importantly to the Notre Dame. I'm not sure if Agora St Germain hotel was the best value for money. Well, it was a busy period in Paris due to the Rugby Cup so many hotels were fully booked and other put up the prices. Given the overall experience, I will consider another hotel in the area in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveler4444Usa
Reviews.Content: This hotel got my credit card information when the hotel I booked with couldn't get me a room and without my consent charged my credit card as I didn't show up. I have emailed but the answer is that the owner is out of town so there is nothing they can do and asked my original hotel to contact them as they were the ones that booked for me (without my authorization) and they told me they are really sorry but the hotel is not willing to reverse the charges and the only way I can get this resolved is filing a credit card fraud claim as I did not sign or give my credit information to this hotel. Be careful with your credit card information when dealing with this hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fine enough, a pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Otherpeoplestravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights on tripadvisor recommendation. A pleasant enough experience. Reception staff professional, room adequate, very nice location. Starting each day with a less than two minute walk to Notre Dame and a leisurely stroll down the Seine is pretty blissful. Amazing pastries served in the hotel breakfast room -- make sure you try them!! I'd most likely stay here again when I visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Angeli
Reviews.Content: The Agora hotel met our needs perfectly on this trip. Without repeating too much of what the other reviewers have said, the Agora was: -In a quieter area of the Latin Quarter, just enough away from the really touristy part but still with enough restaurants, bakeries and metro stop (Maubert) in close walking distance. -Enhanced by extremely friendly and helpful staff. Booking for both the dinner cruise and shuttle bus to the airport were efficient and without any problems. -Very clean! the bathroom in particular spotless and very modern. Room was small (even in our superior room) but there was a nice view and adequate space for our needs. All in all a very nice boutique hotel which was value for money. I booked directly via the hotel and found that price to be the cheapest.

Reviews.Title: “Agora-phile”
Reviews.Author: ANorthsider
Reviews.Content: After reading good reviews here, booked the Agora well in advance for a 2-night stay. Location excellent, stone's throw from Maubert-Mutualité metro station and St Michel RER for train to/from CDG. Sites on doorstep: Panthéon, Sorbonne, Notre Dame, Boul. St Germain...Staff very friendly. Room small (c'est Paris, n'est-ce pas?) but comfortable. Very clean. Super-modern bathroom. LCD TV. Street-side room can be noisy at night - tip: turn on the a/c for a while before bed, then turn off and leave window closed before sleeping. Eric Kayser just around corner on Rue Monge great for breakfast. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hote.”
Reviews.Author: Dalewhit
Reviews.Content: The Agora St. Germain lives up to the high ratings others have given it. The rooms, whle small, are impeccably clean. The bathrooms are modern and spotless, and everything works exactly as it should. (You may need a little coaching on the handles in the tub, which are somewhat unusual by American standards.) The staff was unfailingly polite and helpful. The street is quiet and has little traffic, and the windows are excellent in keeping out even that meager noise. The air conditioning is quiet and effective. The TV (a new flat panel) will give you the BBC and CNN in English, in addition to a number of French channels. The location is excellent; the nearest Metro stop (Maubert-Mutualite) is only a 5 minute walk, and Notre Dame is a ten minute walk. There are dozens of restuarants, groceries, and patisseries nearby. You can walk to the beautiful Luxembourg Gardens in 15 minutes. One caution: the hotel does not provide face cloths, so you might wish to bring your own. Overall, the Agora is a little more costly than the "budget" hotels, but you get so much more quality. It's an outstanding place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: heavierthanheaven87
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend booked this hotel as a surprise for valentines day this year so i was a little sceptial as he booked it without seeing any reviews. We arrived and the check in desk staff were so helpful showing us where our rooms were. The room was lovely , plasma tv on the wall, comfy bed and a really nice bathroom. The woman on the check in desk recommended restaurants and places to visit all of which were wonderful. We were within walking distance of the notre dame and there was a bus stop about 100m from the hotel which took us straight to the effiel tower. The breakfast was wonderful and didnt finish until nearly midday. We only stayed the one night in paris and were given a little room to put our bags in while we went out for the final day. i would definatly go back here.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Agora”
Reviews.Author: RiceyReg
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a 2-night stay at this lovely hotel. We booked the hotel on the strength of the positive reviews from other travellers and are happy to now add our own endorsement. The room was a generous size (by Paris standards) and spotlessly clean, as was the modern bathroom. We would have preferred a duvet to blankets, but that would be our only criticism.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: moraorange
Reviews.Content: I booked directly on the hotel website, after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor. They were not wrong. My husband and I stayed at the Agora for 6 nights. Just returned. The staff was pleasent and helpful, the room was, though small, quite ample for the 2 of us. The bathroom was great. Newly renovated. We booked a twin superior (beds pushed together) and had a lovely balcony that faced the church. The neighborhood was lovely and so close to major tourist attractions and the metro stops. Paris was just steps away! I highly recommend this hotel to anyone going to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: gendarme
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Agora Saint Germain for 2 nights and 3 days. The hotel is in the latin quarter with plenty of fine restaurants, bistros and bakeries. The service is excellent and will surely stay there again the next time we visit Paris. I highly recomment this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mokigrand
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at this hotel. Originally, we were supposed to stay 4 mights, but the hotel did not have our reservation in their system. The staff was excellent in terms of finding us a room in a nearby hotel. Then, one staff member walked us to the new hotel so we wouldn't get lost. OUTSTANDING SERVICE! The Agora is very comfortable, and it has air conditioning - a real plus in Paris!!!! The staff is excellent and all spoke very good English. The location is terrific with lots of cafes nearby. Close to Notre Dame the river. I would definitely stay at this hotel again. We highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great 5th Arrondisement Hotel,Paris”
Reviews.Author: bobrobj
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Paris on Sunday 5/27/07,after 8 nights at Hotel Agora St. Germain,Rue des Bernardins. The hotel was very nice,the staff superb,fluent in English,and very helpful. Yes,the elevator was small...so what?The continental breakfast was convenient and good,with unlimited coffee.The rooms were clean,comfortable,and the bathroom/shower newly renovated and very nice.They made our first visit to Paris memorable;also the hotel is within a short walk from Norte Dame.We requested a street side room with a view and got it.There are rooms facing an inside courtyard which would be quieter,but we enjoyed the view and the church bells.Everything was available nearby...bakery Eric Kayser,,a hardware where Ibought a converter,a currency exchange,a wine shop,a cheese store,etc.We would not hesitate to stay there again.....Bob V.

Reviews.Title: “Most helpful staff...ever!”
Reviews.Author: xenophilic
Reviews.Content: I wish I could remember her name now, but the wonderful lady on the front desk was by far the most helpful person I've ever met in a hotel. I had ordered a packet of travel documents delievered to the hotel in advance of my arrival, and instead of just handing the envelope over with my room key, she had picked out several brochures for local tours and attractions as well as a map of the Latin Quarter, upon which she highlighted the closest Metro station. She then gave me step-by-step directions to the station, and made me repeat them to make sure I got it. She let me into the room a few hours early, and when telling me about the breakfast (which was not complimentary) she mentioned there was a wonderful boulangerie just around the corner...which wound up being where I got my breakfast all week. She then said if I needed any help booking anything, I had just to ask and she would handle it. The room itself was not spacious, but comfortable, with a full bath en suite. My room was right above the street, so I heard some traffic noise, but that wasn't really an issue until my last night when there was a movie being filmed around the corner. They had parked a truck with a generator across the street that was running all night long. But in Paris, I guess c'est la vie!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jeremyh
Reviews.Content: After some pretty ordinary experiences with Latin Quarter hotels, this was a delight. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, the rooms were well equipped, clean and comfortable (with good air conditioning), and it is in a great location. After indifference at other hotels, they were attentive here - for example, one day I walked in with a bunch of flowers and they immediately offered to get a vase - at the other places they would have thrown up their hands and shrugged if I had dared ask! Thoroughly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay!”
Reviews.Author: lml39
Reviews.Content: In February a friend and I took a girl's trip to Paris. Being the high-maintenance females that we are, our 1st choice was The Four Seasons but seeing as how we are not independently wealthy we had to come back to reality and find a suitable hotel in our budget. We literally spent every night for a week researching online, talking to friends who traveled to Paris, and coworkers who live in Paris for the best hotel. We read and heard such scary things. I travel quite frequently for work but have heard some horror stories about Paris so we were extra cautious. I am very pleased to report that we made a fantastic choice. Now, we did read the negative reviews of this hotel about the tiny elevator, small rooms, the chuch bells and the heat. I do have to say that yes, its all true but none of it bothered us. I don't recommend the hotel for a honeymoon but for 2 girls who only needed a clean place to sleep and shower this hotel was awesome! The elevator was small but we both fit at the same time so it was no problem for us! We did have to take separate trips with all of our luggage but hey, you can't have everything! The room was small but there was enough room for each of us to put our stuff and get around. The best part is how immaculately clean it was! The bathroom looked brand new! You can't beat that. It did get warm in the room so we just kept the balcony doors opened a crack and it was fine. The church across the street did grace us with a wake-up call at 8:00 am on a Fri am but seeing as how we were already up and getting ready, it didn't bother us. Of course, the next day we were counting on the bells to wake us up and they didn't ring! YIKES! So don't count on them to be your wake-up call. The hotel is in a great location. It is right off of St. Germain street which we were told is the spot to dine. There are some great bars along the side streets too! Its a 10 min walk to Notre Dame and 20 mins to The Louvre. The hotel staff was so lovely! They were extremely helpful and polite and they speak English perfectly. Normally, I don't write reviews but because of the ordeal I went through to find this hotel, thanks to the many people who wrote reviews before me on TripAdvisor, I felt it owed it back to everyone to share my fantastic experience. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific experience”
Reviews.Author: rainbowdreamer
Reviews.Content: My daughter (age 21) and I just returned from an overnight stay in Paris. We were so pleased with the Agora and would highly recommend it. We booked through the hotel website and the price was under $200. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel but instead went to the cafe around the corner and had a lovely breakfast for 5 Euro - tea/coffee/hot chocolate, croissant or bread and butter, orange juice. Our room 67, had 2 twin beds pushed together, a clean bathroom with bath and shower, and a street view. The hotel is on a very quiet street in the Latin Quarter. The church bells do ring throughout the day, but we really couldn't hear them with the window closed. There are many great cafes nearby, as well as an outdoor market. The metro stop is very close. The front desk staff was so friendly and spoke very good English. The elevator is very tiny. This was our first trip to Paris. We traveled on the Eurostar from London. I would definitely want to come back again to this beautiful city and would choose this hotel as well as recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay at the Agora St Germain”
Reviews.Author: SetsofWaves
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 nights in Paris at the Agora St Germain. Booked the room as part of a vacation package through the airline. The location is excellent-- only a few blocks away from Notre Dame de Paris and the Ile de la Cite. The closest metro stop was "Maubert / Mutualite" which allowed us to get around quite easily. Visitors who haven't been to Paris before should learn to use the Metro immediately-- its so simple and gets you close to just about everything you'll want to see. Also, there were a few pedestrian streets nearby that were filleds with restaurants that seemed to cater to a lot of tourists. Food there was good and inexpensive, and stress free. Lots of choices. Breakfast was included in our fee, which consisted of coffee or tea with some croissants or other morning breads. Nothing too extraordinary-- but a very typical French Breakfast. It was nice to have breakfast at the hotel before starting out. The room was small, as are most rooms in Europe, but very clean and very nice. Our room overlooked the Rue des Bernardins adn the church or St Nicolas du Chadonnet. At times the bells of the church were a bit much (every morning they toll at 7h45 for a few minutes. Otherwise its just every hours) but I suppose that's part of the charm. We had a large bed, refrigerator, television, closet, etc. All the basics. We were really only in the room to sleep anyway. The bathroom was quite a nice surprise-- brand new fixtures. The shower was clean and warm. Big enough to take a bath to relax after long days of sightseeing. The staff was friendly and helpful. When you leave the hotel you leave your key at the desk, and whenever you return you just ask for it back. It was nice not having to worry about forgetting your room key. Be advised that next door to the Agora St Germain is a Hostel, and as such there were noisy young travelers in the street past midnight on some nights. Also, there is an amazing amount of traffic for such a small street-- so there's a lot of noise from the cars and scooters. When we closed our window, it was quiet again. There was a small air conditioner that cooled the small room very quickly. I don't know how well it would work on a sizzling summer day, but in the unseasonably warm spring it did just fine. Overall, we were very happy with our stay. Of course, its not the Ritz-- but it was a perfect location, the rooms were clean and comfortable, and the staff was friendly. It exceeded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend the ASG”
Reviews.Author: pkloer
Reviews.Content: We lucked into this dependable 3-star hotel for our first trip to Paris, and highly recommend it. Staff was very pleasant and helpful, all good English speakers. Room was quiet, clean, bathroom pretty large for big-city 3-star hotel. Great location on Left Bank just off Blvd. St. Germain surrounded by ATMs, bakeries, small food shops, restaurants. About 3-4 minute walk to Metro, maybe 10 minutes to Notre Dame, 15 minutes to Internet cafe. No issues.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: pierreGreenBay
Reviews.Content: This is a quaint hotel in a nice neighborhood in Paris. The staff speaks English and they are very helpful. It is close to Notre Dame and the Latin Quarter. There is an outdoor market open almost every day within one block. There are many bakeries and deli's in the area. The breakfast at the hotel is very good. French croissants and great french bread with very good cheese. It is close to the Metro, money exchange and ATM. We enjoyed our stay and will stay there again when in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Basic Needs”
Reviews.Author: AA82
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a 5-night stay at this hotel. I booked it via their own website, which had much better rates than any of the big travel sites. First, I should state that I was looking for a good value hotel, nothing fancy, but with a clean room and in a great location. The Agora definitely satisfied those needs for me. With their internet rate, I was able to get a superior room here for less than it would have cost for a standard room at what I believe to be comparable hotels in the area. So I booked a superior double room for my boyfriend and me, but when we got to the hotel our room (17) was unavailable because of a problem with the air conditioner. No other superior rooms were available so we took a standard room for the night (room 15) until one opened up the next day. They were very nice and apologetic about this, and we were also understanding and just looked at it as a way to save a little bit of money for one night. Room 15 faced inwards to an air shaft- which they decorated at the ground floor to make a sort of cute little garden- and had a double bed, with barely enough room to walk around especially if you have a lot of luggage. The bathroom is very nice but opens up literally right at the bed, so there is really hardly any privacy even with the door closed. The next day we were moved to room 29 (superior), which faced the street outside, had 2 twin beds pushed together (which I wanted, becuase I think you get a little extra bed that way), and was set up more like any hotel room you'd see in the US. The bathroom was separate from the main room area, and there was a desk. Both rooms had a 19 inch or so plasma tv, which was nice. Both also had a mini-fridge/minibar. I'd say for the extra little bit of money (maybe $50 a night), it is definitely worth it to stay in the superior room, because we would not have been comfortable in the standard for five days. There was just not enough space for us. Both rooms were a little stuffy, but we usually left the windows open while we went out for the day, which the maid closed during her cleaning, and then it was fine when we got back. Housekeeping was good and made up the rooms really nice. Hotel is in a great location- even closer to the Maubert Mutualite metro station than I thought from looking at maps. The 10 metro line definitely isnt the most useful one, but it's just one stop or an extra 5-8 minutes walking to a big transfer station. RIght down the street from the hotel is a strip of food stores- cheese store, wine store, butcher, fish store, bakeries.... literally anything you could need. We went to Maison Kaiser a lot for croissants, baguettes and sandwiches. Very good bakery. Most days there was a nice little market that opened up right there as well. Really great to walk through. If you walk straight up Rue des Bernardins you'll end up at the Seine within a few minutes, and the street turns right into a bridge to Ile de la Cite so it is really a great block to be on. We ate dinner every night in the area- 3 great ones in walking distance, Les Bouquinistes, Le Petit Pontoise, and Le Coupe Chou. We also ate a couple nights in a very touristy area off Rue St. Jacques by Notre Dame... both meals were horrible (in one you'd hear the microwave beeping every couple minutes when people's meals were done!). We should have known. But those other 3 restaurants were truly amazing. Overall, I was pleased with this hotel because it met my needs (which were, admittedly, somewhat basic, but I think similar to what most people look for in a Paris hotel). I wouldn't necessarily go there on my honeymoon, but for a trip where you'll barely be in the room it was a nice place to end the day. We liked that it was very close to the center of things but still a little off on a quiet side street (besides the horrible church bells every 30 min in the morning) and we kind of felt like we were going "home" every night. Get a superior room and you should be pleased with the quality of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Really liked this hotel”
Reviews.Author: kk8price
Reviews.Content: I just returned from another visit to Paris and enjoyed my stay at the Hotel Agora. Katrine at the front desk is very helpful and all the staff members speak some or quite a bit of english if you need help. The room was not huge for a single but it was just fine for one person. Bathroom was great with lots of hot water and it was very clean also. Breakfast is also very adequate with cereal, bread, cheese, juices and coffee. No hot food but it was still good and fresh. Location is great. Near to 2 metro stops and there are great restaurants and cafes all over the place as you are very near (1 block away) from the Blvd. St. Germain.

Reviews.Title: “Agora Saint Germain”
Reviews.Author: benjobobs
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Agora Saint Germain for 3 nights in March. Great location - 5 minute walk from Notre Dame and close to lots of restaurants and bars. Nice clean rooms (altho. on the small side but that 's the way it is in Paris). Staff very friendly and helpful. Had breakfast at the Best Monge (turn left out of the hotel and left again) good continental breakfast juice, croissant, jam and coffee for 5 euros - really nice guy (Zirro). Only had good experiences in Paris - everyone was very friendly - definitely will be returning and would stay at the Agora St. Germain again.Easily accessible from the RER (just over 8 euros) from Charles de Gaule (follow instructions at airport to RER) take the blue line to Notre Dame/St Michel then about a 10 minute walk. Most people on the station speak English (we did try a little french and I think they were pleased about that!!)

Reviews.Title: “Above average at the Agora”
Reviews.Author: Scottishbabe123
Reviews.Content: My Fiance and I stayed at the Agora for 3 nights in the beginning of March 2007. We found the staff very pleasant and helpful. They recommended shops, tours, places to eat and attractions. They booked our Moulin Rouge trip and ensured that our car turned up to take us back to the airport on the last day. The elevator was a bit compact and the Hallways/Stairwells were a bit narrow. Our room faced onto the internal atrium. At frst I was disappointed that we did not have a view, but in retrospect, I am glad that we had peace and quiet away from the street. Our room had comtemporary decor and attactive furnishings, but again, it was quite small. The En Suite was fully tiled with a power shower. The room was clean and in good condition. Continental breakfast was included and was as expected. We found the location very good. St. Germain area is lovely with it's own outdoor market, an abundance of shops and places to eat. Very close to Maubert Mutualite metro station. Would stay here again if I am ever back in this lovely city.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Traveler0000
Reviews.Content: Excellent location - easy walk to the river with spectacular views of Notre Dame at night. Very convenient to Metro and bus stops or a pleasant walk to Cite. Room was very comfortable, bathroom spotless. Staff very friendly and helpful. All spoke very good English. Pleasant breakfast room. Wonderful bakery and market just around the corner. The Fromagiere will vacuum pack your cheese for easy passage through Customs. We were on top floor on street - nice view with little balcony. Only complaint was room got a little warm and we opened balcony door to cool, but a lot of traffic noise until 1 or 2 am.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Dinos_a
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with my family (4 persons in the end of October 2006) for two nights Location is very good, next to the local Metro station. Rooms and bathrooms are renovated and clean, the former though are quite small. Breakfast choice is rather dull, much better try the boulangerie round the corner, with freshly made French delicacies and excellent coffee. Staff is friendly by French standards. Overall very good value for money, considering also the time one spends in the hotel while in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Ideally placed & value for Money Agora St Germain”
Reviews.Author: M&C.Booth
Reviews.Content: The Agora St Germain is ideally situated for a weekend break in Paris being only a short stroll away from Notre Dame. This was our third trip to Paris on the trot and we were looking to visit on a reasonably tight budget without going too down market. Although the Hotel and rooms were smaller than previously experienced, they were found to be very clean and comfortable. The hotel staff were all warm and friendly from the reception, maids and restaurant. The locality has everything on the doorstep from cash machines, bars, restaurants, cafes and tourist attractions to suit everyones pocket. If you want 4* plus luxury then the Agora St Germain is not for you. If you want value for money and a clean, friendly well located base then it definitely is. Martin & Caroline Booth West Yorkshire

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and well furnished”
Reviews.Author: swanseabayview
Reviews.Content: We had a twin bedded room on the 5th floor with a small balcony (Room 57) which overlooked the street. It was surpisingly quiet except when the church bells rang at 7.30 or 8.00 am. The room was small but well furnished. My partner thought the bathroom was superb. We used the breakfast room only once which was also attractively furnished. The breakfast costs 10 euro and there is a limited but adequate choice. There are plenty of places to eat nearby. For breakfast Kaysers is good althought a bit expensive.For evening meals if you turn right after you leave the hotel and turn right along the next street there is a variety of restautrants. The hotel is a few minutes walk from the Maubert Mutialite metro station and is convenient for Notre Dame. We did have a bit of difficulty working out where we were when we arrived at the metro station in the dark and the way to the hotel. I suggest you ask the hotel for directions.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Parisphile
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hotel Agora St Germain for 4 nights in December (!) 2006 as we wanted to spend our 25 th wedding anniversary in Paris. My wife (like most wives) has high standards about cleanliness, food, decor, service etc. so I'm always hoping that our lodgings will be up to scratch as this is an important part of her enjoyment of our trips. The Hotel Agora St Germain exceeded our expectations as it was clean , well-run and friendly. The last bit was very important as we have been to France three or four times on family holidays and always had a good time, but we had never been to Paris and the impression we got from friends and our own research was that Paris could be a very unfriendly place and that the service in Hotels and Restaurants left a bit to be desired. The staff in the Agora ,however, were excellent, particularly the guys on the reception desk. We saw three different ones while we were there and each was cheerful, helpful, knowledgeable about the local area (and Paris in general) and patient with our poor command of French. The lady who looked after the breakfast room was delightful and got full marks from my wife who noticed that she was continually going round the room making sure that everything was just so, topping up the coffee etc. We saw two chambermaids while we were there and both ladies greeted us with a smile and "bonjour" each time we passed. The rooms were provided with fresh linen and towels every day and were cleaned to a very high standard. The Hotel is well-situated for the sights of Paris, particularly Notre Dame, which is about five minutes walk from the hotel - ideal for a romantic morning stroll with the bells ringing, leaves blowing around your feet and the wonderful smells from the boulangeries.The Jardins De Luxembourg, which is about ten minutes walk from the Hotel is a pleasant walk (don't forget to take some bread for the ducks in the Fontaine des Medicis.) If you are a Da Vinci Code bore, St Sulpice is about 5-10 mins away. Other places of interest such as the Tour Eiffel, the Musee D'Orsay, Les Invalides and the Louvre are within 15 - 20 min walk. The Arc De Triomphe and the part of the Champs- Elysees with the shops is about 30 min walk. Montmartre and the Sacre Coeur would probably be best visited using the Metro or the bus. The area around the Hotel has loads of Bistros, Brasseries, Bar-Tabacs and Restaurants of all kinds, we had meals in about five of them and all were good, though a bit expensive, expect to pay about 8 Euros for 50Cl. of beer, about 8 - 14 Euros for a pizza, about 10 - 16 Euros for a steak. The only thing that might be a probem at this Hotel is the fact that St. Nicholas' Church is next door and the bells ring quite often, we liked this as it added to the ambience, some people might not. Some tips if you haven't visited Paris before: Get to know the Metro, it is really efficient, cheap and the best way to get around, although it looks complicated at first. The trains come every few minutes. Taxis are very expensive. Learn a little bit of French. Even just "Hello", "thanks","goodbye" "how much is it?" etc. This will smooth things along very much for you, particularly in Paris where they clearly appreciate any attempt to speak French. Paris is amazingly cosmopolitan, you will see people from all over the world. Spare a thought for the Parisians dealing with all these different languages, customs etc. They are often relieved and pleased when someone tries to do things their way and ease the transaction, especially fellow Europeans. Get to the sights early, there can be very long queues. We were there in December and were amazed how busy it was, during the high season it must be manic. Take boat trip on the Seine at night - if you are there as a couple - it is just one of the most romantic things you can do. Guys -if it's cold you might get a cuddle. There is a lot to see and do in Paris - don't expect to get round everything in a week. To sum up: The Hotel Agora St. Germain is a good, clean, well-run hotel in an interesting area of Paris which is reasonably well-situated to visit all the main sights. We will definitely be returning there.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: greenchili2
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at Hotel Agora Saint Germain in Paris in mid-November, 2006. The hotel is not fancy, but very clean, quiet and in a great location. It is a short walk to the Seine and Notre Dame. There are lots of good and not outrageously expensive restaurants within walking distance. The staff speaks English well and were very helpful with all our questions. We would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to be in this part of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mossmania
Reviews.Content: Spent five nights here with my wife in October. Overall it was fine. Encountered only minor frustrations - for example, the hotel advertised that they run a shuttle for 18 Euros per person to CDG airport but claimed there weren't enough people to justify the shuttle when we asked for it the night before our departure. They called a taxi instead and promised a rate of 40-50 Euros, although the taxi charged us over 60 Euros. C'est la vie, I guess. Stayed in two different rooms - one with balcony, one facing into interior courtyard. Preferred the balcony room. Both rooms had very nice washrooms. The hotel was quiet. Breakfast was nice, but you could probably put the Euros to better use elsewhere. Perfect if you want to be in the lively Latin quarter.

Reviews.Title: “super friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: alleluia
Reviews.Content: Hotel Agora St germain is extremely well located,near Notre Dame,in a quiet side st,close to the Pantheon. The staff is very friendly and helpful. If you do not want their breakfast the little boulangerie right around the corner offers a wonderful breakfast, coffee,juice and yogurt. Try to get a room with a window on the inside courtyard, you won't hear a sound. The hotel is listed as a 3* but really should be a 2*, the rooms are very small but the bathrooms are new and very cleaned. ATM unit right across the street, very close to a metro stop. We probably would stay there again or in the same vicinity From Boston,Massachusetts

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: Suetonius
Reviews.Content: Although seasoned visitors to France, it was our first time in Paris. Booking the hotel though Eurostar, it was, consequently, pot luck. . . . but we needn't have worried. The hotel was spotlessly clean and - not knowing the ropes - we had a room ending in 5 (see previous review) . . . . but it was excellent. Admittedly, the room size - while more than adequate - was a tad on the small side, but so what? You don't go to Paris to sit in your hotel room! It had obviously recently been refurbished and was spotless - as for the bathroom, I wouldn't mind one like that myself! The lift was interesting - I almost killed my wife trying to shoehorn both of us and our luggage in - we nearly had hysteria. A typical, small, family run hotel. But the real clincher was the staff. They were friendly, courteous, helpful and spoke far better English than my "plume de ma tante" French. Situated in a quiet road no more than 100 metres from the Boulevard St Germain, it is superbly placed - especially near the Latin Quarter with its multitudinous bistros & restaurants. I would recommend it to anyone as superb value for money. Unfortunately for our bank account, my wife is already talking about "when we go back"!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: maddiefirst
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as a package via Eurostar and it was excellent. The staff were, without exception, pleasant and helpful. The rooms were clean and the bathrooms wonderful. The only adverse comment is, no mirror in the bedroom, even a small one for make-up would have been good. We did not have breakfast in the hotel but used the excellent cafe round the corner The location was just right for all we wanted to do. We will definatley go back and will recommend to friends .

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: RonelR
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Paris after a two-week holiday in France. We stayed at the Agora St Germain for three nights and found it reasonably priced, well-positioned, clean and sufficient for our requirements. The room was spacious enough for two people, and the bathroom was attractive and quite big for Paris. We had a room facing the courtyard, which was both private and quiet. The staff were most helpful and very friendly, and both receptionists we dealt with spoke English. The hotel is a hop, skip and jump away from the Blvd St Germain and the Seine, and is also very near Rue Mouffetard, a great area for wining and dining (try Robert's Le Pot a Feu restaurant for great food and great value -- 14.90 euros for a three-course menu!). All in all a very positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: MegKnows
Reviews.Content: The hotel is lovely, clean, and tastefully decorated, but the best part is its location -- a short walk to Notre Dame and all the restaurants and bars of the Latin Quarter. Avoid breakfast -- definitely not worth the fee.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: PrincipalOLG
Reviews.Content: Agora St. Germaine was refered by a relative as a wonderful place to stay and visit Paris. After staying there myself, I felt compelled to write a review. The hotel is very clean and neat, well air conditioned and in a great location. You are a short walk from Notre Dame, the Pantheon, the Louvre, and numerous metro stops. There is excellent food in the Latin Quarter, which is much more fun than the areas that seem geared to tourists. We were even able to find a Starbucks nearby - how lame! There is a bakery just around the corner from the hotel that makes THE BEST CROISSANTS EVER - no contest! You can get an espresso and a croissant for under 2 euro and start your morning off right. That being said, there is no reason to eat the breakfast at the hotel, although they do offer one. Overall, it was a great place to stay. It was far more attractive than any of the hotels near the Eiffel Tower (which cost more) because there is little else in that area except the Eiffel Tower. I would not consider staying anywhere else in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “a great 3 star”
Reviews.Author: sparkggl
Reviews.Content: my husband and i stayed at agora st. germain for 6 nights (8/2-8/7) for our honeymoon. i did extensive research before i chose a hotel and i was satisifed with this one and would return again. i was apprehensive at first about this place because my husband stayed at a 5 star and a 4 star in london for the first leg of our honeymoon, and i was afraid that after staying at such nice places i would be disappointed with a 3 star. however, i was pleasantly surprised! yes, the elevator is tiny and the rooms are small, but there are a lot of great points: the bathrooms are really clean and modern, and the bed was sufficient for my husband and i (he's 6 ft. 180 lbs). we had a good view of the street outside our hotel, and my only complaint is that there was construction going on (as there is in a lot of paris) so the noise level was pretty annoying in the mornings. you should call/email them ahead of time to request a room with a view and balcony. we got the view but weren't able to get a room with a balcony. we made our reservations through the hotel website and got an awesome deal. the desk staff was friendly enough but they weren't too helpful with questions about tourist attractions, etc... but then again, they weren't a concierge desk. my husband and i went to a little place to pick up croissants every morning called les delices du forneil (i'm sure i butchered the spelling). they were friendly and their croissants are heavenly. there's a closer place to the hotel called eric kayser that just moved 2 doors down from its previous location and their croissants and pain chocolat look incredible, but they're not so good. but maybe i caught them on bad days. their desserts, however (esp the one with raspberries on top) are amazing. if you get a chance, hit up a gyro stand. they top the gyro with french fries and it's so good. and at 4 euros, it's the cheapest meal you'll ever get in paris. as far as location, the maubert metro stop is really close by. i loved being so close to notre dame and we would often picnic there while gazing at the flying buttresses. the luxembourg gardens are also beautiful for a picnic. i really liked the location of this hotel because it's not too touristy (like the hotels on champs elysee) but it's still close enough to the main attractions. btw, check out saint chapelle. AMAZING. my advice for first-timers: go on the fat bike tour in the evening. it's operated by americans and you get to bike through the city, take a boat ride on the seine, and just have a blast. my husband and i went on the bike tour the day we arrived in paris and i would say that my favorite memory of our trip is riding my bike through the courtyard of the louvre at sunset, seeing the larger-than-life pyramids for the first time with my husband. wow. all in all, the agora st. germain was a great 3 star hotel and we would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Good Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NessW
Reviews.Content: I think this would be a pretty typical 3 star hotel in Paris but you might find one for the same price that is not as far east as this - The Agora St Germain was about 500m from Notre Damn metro stop, there are 2 others stops closer but Notre Damn is on more lines so we felt like we walked alot to get to and from the hotel from here, the walk along the river is lovely but we were usually exhausted from a full day and just wanted to get off the metro and be home!! I would definately stay on the left bank again but would look for a hotel slightly more central. The rooms are very small but modern - the smallest rooms we encountered on our 4 week trip through Europe. You really wouldn't want to spend much more time in your room than sleeping & changing. The bathrooms although tiny are very modern and clean. The patisserie around the corner is fanastic for breakfast (Eric Kayser). The hotel stored our bags while we went to Loire Valley for 2 nights which was very convenient and it looked like our bags hadn't been touched at all while we were away. Our air conditioning didn't work for 2 nights and it was very very hot, we asked for a discount becuase we had double checked that the hotel had air con' before we confirmed our stay but the manager wasn't on and we have since emailed and they will not offer us any credit - except one free night next time in Paris - we are in NZ which is 24 hours flight from Paris so I dont know when we will be back!! We didn't find the staff overly helpful when we asked questions about tourist attractions but they were friendly enough. We didn't experience any of the French rudeness that we had heard about, we had a phrase book and always tried our best in french and most people would reply in english laughing at us!! Plus the beds are not full sized doubles my husbands feet were over the edge (he is 6foot1) and we were very squashed and are not really big people!!

Reviews.Title: “c'est manifique!!”
Reviews.Author: LOUISE1HAWTHORN
Reviews.Content: Have just returned to England from a sweltering Paris absolutley thrilled with the Agora.
