Very modern, almost boutique style lobby and room and fantastic bathroom ( room 47) Air conditioning was excellent and much appreciated!Couldn't be better situated; one of the best patisseries in Paris around the corner ( Eric Kayser) also try their violet ice cream but maybe not for breakfast!, a little supermarket open selling ice and bottled water, very handy in the 99 degrees! Quickest way to the river is left out of the hotel and straight down Rue Bernadins , about 3 minutes. The lovely cheese shop on the square near to the hotel vacum packs cheese to bring home and 4 lots just about fit into our room refridgerater. On the last day, we couldn't handle dragging our cases through the streets and couldn't get the airport shuttle from the hotel as you have to book in advance. However, we hailed a cab from outside the hotel taking us straight to Charles d Gaulle and it cost only 2 euros more than the shuttle! All in all a fantastic stay, yet again tripadvisor gets it right and I will recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Love room 58”
Reviews.Author: BillMcAdam
Reviews.Content: Lodged at the Agora Ste Germaine from 6/29-7/2, second stop on our Honeymoon. First assigned room 45 and requested and received room 58 with balcony and view for next two evenings, Rooms ending in 7 or 8 have nice view of church accross street and higher up you can see towers of Notre Dame. Request not to be assigned room ending in 5, only view is other side of building. Location is just wonderful, Place de St.Michel is about five minute walk as is Notre Dame. Rooms are small but typical of Paris, rooms are spotless and bathrooms bright and just updated. Fantastic Cigar shop at 3 rue Lagrange, stopped by to pick out a nightly Habana each night. Found the front desk to be very helpful, especially Guillume. Take a walk down the Rue Des Ecoles and sample some of the outdoor cafe's away from Ste Germaine crowds. Walk up the hill and visit the Pantheon in the morning and have your choice of pastry shops to sample coming back. Nice outdoor market by Maubert Metro on Saturdays. Take a taxi from train station to hotel 18 euros and have the front desk reserve a shuttle back to CDG for 18 euros per person. Would return to property.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely little hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Agora St-Germain is a lovely, little three-star hotel in the Latin Quarter. The closest metro is Maubert-Mutualitie. The lobby is vaguely art deco and the room, though small, was comfortable. As is typical in Paris, there are tall windows. Ours faced the street and a typically Parisian street scene: church, flowers, trees, rooftops. Breakfast was a little expensive--10 euros--but fresh and delicious. We had it brought to the room and ate with the windows pushed open and the sun streaming in. The staff, especially a woman named Aline, was very helpful and knowledgeable. Although it's a little far east, it's only a few blocks from Notre Dame and the river. We booked online in advance and felt we had gotten a good deal. I will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: ClaudiaB
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights earlier this month. The very best thing about the hotel is the location and the second best thing is that the air-conditioning in the rooms works quite well. (Having stayed in European hotels where this is not the case I was very grateful for this - it was very hot when we were in Paris.) I would also be remiss if I did not mention the helpfulness of the front desk staff - especially Aline. She gave us great info about the immediate and went to great effort to help us find whatever we needed! On the down side, the rooms are small and a bit shabby - but quite clean. The elevators are TINY and the hall is narrow. If you anticipate spending much time in your room you might want something larger. The TV was fine - I did not anticipate English-speaking channels and we had fun trying to follow the storyline with our very limited French. We would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby... but good location.”
Reviews.Author: Kennio
Reviews.Content: The pictures you are seeing on this website are misleading either making the Hotel look like a palace, are out of focus or are of some Paris attraction. I would equate the room quality with a hotel near the highway here in the United States; well worn. It has a small elevator that is about 26 inches wide! The corridors are less than 4 feet wide. There is a bit of a bad smell in the lobby which comes and goes. The rooms are very small with one channel on television in english. If you get this hotel really, really cheap...you will be satisfied. Under no circumstances expect more than just a place to sleep and you will be fine here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel! So glad we chose it!!!”
Reviews.Author: 6boys4me
Reviews.Content: We just returned yesterday from a one week stay in Paris to celebrate our 25th anniversary. I had spent 2 weeks reasearching hotel reviews as I wanted something special, but couldn't afford the likes of the Ritz Carlton. And we couldn't have been happier with the Agora! It was super clean, fresh soft sheets, newly remodeled bathroom, (very modern) We got a room (#49) with a view of the beautiful old St. Nicholas du Chardonnet church across the street. The room was sound proofed and very quiet. And we just loved hearing the gentle peal of the church bells in the morning. It was so charming!!! The staff was terrific (especially Elaine) and there's air conditioning in the room to keep you comfortable, along with a flat screen plasma t.v. and built in blow dryer (which was great not to have to bring our own and try to find electrical adapters to use over there.) The elevator is tiny as others stated. But so what! You are always free to take the stairs next to the elevator. That's what we did going down. Taking it when going up to our room, and wasn't a problem to have to stand close to each other for 60 seconds. The hotel lobby was nicely appointed, and comfortable, with a morning paper in English to catch up on world news. The breakfast room downstairs was very nice, and yeah, 10 euros apiece seemed a bit high for the breakfast, but we did eat there twice in the week, and it was kind of nice having as much coffee as we needed without having to pay 5 euro for one cup elsewhere. There's fresh baked croissants, Pain au chocolate (chocolate croissant), baguette, cheeses, butter, jam, cereal, juice, tea, coffee, yogurt. And the french yogurt is REALLY good. Different than we get in the U.S. Much creamier! So while you can certainly go to a local pastry shop or cafe for breakfast, there's times when it's pretty convenient to just go downstairs and enjoy your fill of coffee, and plan your day out in the peace of the breakfast room, rather than on the busy sidewalk. You've got room to open your metro and city maps on the table. The location is PERFECT! You've got an ATM machine just outside the hotel, a 5min. walk to Notre Dame Cathedral, 5 min. walk to shops, metro station, farmer's market, restaurants, etc. A note to anyone who's never been to Paris: buy a one week pass for the metro, and at the same window, also buy the one week museum pass. A MUST!!! this way you don't have to wait in the long lines at the Lovre, (over 2 hrs wait otherwise) or Musee d'ORsay, or Palace at Versailles. You can just go to the front gate for reserved tickets. Well worth the money spent. You can get all over the place with the metro, it has good connections. And the pass also allows you to use the trains or buses within a certain region. If you do go outside your area, then you'll just have to pay a couple euros extra to exit the station. No big deal. I'd recommend this Agora St. Germaine to anyone, and wished I hadn't wasted so much time looking at all the other hotels. I'd go back in a heartbeat, if we ever go again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: raffi1909
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from 4 nights at this hotel and can thoroughly recommend it. The surrounding area is delightful - clean and safe, quiet at night and with a great bakery/patisserie a few steps away for breakfast. A very short walk leads to the river, the Batobus stop, and the most stunning view of Notre Dame. An equally short walk in another direction will take you to the fascinating Latin Quarter, Cluny Museum, Luxembourg Gardens, etc. I have mobility problems, and I can't imagine a better location, as there was so much of charm and interest nearby. As others have said, the lift is small, and so was our bathroom, but everything was beautifully clean, and our 6th-floor room had a juliet balcony and french windows looking onto the street. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and we enjoyed our stay enormously.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Cunningham8
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a wonderful location as detailed in previous reviews. It is a small hotel with small rooms and bathrooms and an extremely small lift - be warned! This lift held two reasonably slim people with small weekend bags - I can't imagine what it would be like for two large people with full sized suitcases, I think probably you would have to go in shifts. Also might be a problem with someone with a lift phobia or claustrophobia. Thankfully we didn't have that. The rooms were small, clean and the refurbished bathrooms were lovely but again very small. Your early morning wake-up call is the local church whose bells starting ringing at around 7.00 a.m. The breakfast room was nicely decorated but the breakfast was definitely not worth 10 Euros as evidenced by the relatively few people who were eating there on our first morning. The other two mornings we spent around the corner in the bakery which was really good. The staff were very pleasant and helpful and we really enjoyed our stay. However, I have stayed in 3* hotels in Paris on three other occasions and this hotel did not quite match up to the standard of the others.

Reviews.Title: “cestboncestbon”
Reviews.Author: cestbon
Reviews.Content: completed a 6 night stay in Paris at the Agora St Germain (March 23-29)and found the hotel met all expectations and then some....getting the nits picked first...the hotel lobby was being renovated and was unusable for anything other than collecting your room key (you had to turn it in when you left)and the hotel stored material in the narrow hall (we had rooms 4 & 5) this was some remedied by the time we left and the lobby was pleasently comfy for a small group to meet in. The staff was tremendous. Period. They went above the call and helped one of our party confirm airline connections and aquired a taxi during a general strike day....and everybody appeared on cue!..always pleasant and helpful for eating recommendations and help avoiding the "protestations"...the location is wonderful for jumping off into old Paris being two blocks from Notre Dame and Ile de St. Louis and Blvd St Germain a main street for bus connections and good restaurants. We had a double (5) and a triple (4) that were very comfy though for the same price I would reequest the triple..(double bed and a single). Each room had a small refrigerator and a simple closet for clothes and room for a suitcase under...two simple chairs..a very nicely appointed and apparently newly remodeled bathroom...large by European standards. We had some difficulty regulating the heat in the rooms.(too warm) and we had rooms that looked across an interior courtyard into the lobby....had to make sure the drapes were closed getting dressed... there was no problem with noise that doesn't occur in any hotel. Around the corner was a small neighborhood outdoor market that occurs on tues/thurs/sat that had a little of everything. At the same place was a cheese shop, mini grocery, pharmacy, bakery, and small cafe for your pleasure. ATM's and bank branches are very convenient. I would recommend this hotel and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Paris, but my husbands 3rd so he was able to scout out nice areas to stay in. When we decided to stay in the Latin Quarter, however, we actually chose this hotel through Trip Advisor. I must say that was one of our best decisions. The hotel was fantastic. I could tell it was old, but they were able to update it quite tastfully. I really enjoyed going up the small elevator. All that could fit was myself and our luggage. My husband climbed the 4 flights of stairs and met me up there to unload. The room was pretty small to US standards, but quite cozy. Everything was clean. We had two sets of french doors (small) that we could open for fresh air. Although there was some road noise when they were opened (added to the ambiance of being in Paris) we couldn't hear a thing when they were closed. As a matter of fact, we opened the windows each night. The location of the hotel was perfect, too. We basically walked EVERYWHERE. It was cold, but since it was sunny, we just bundled up and took to the streets. When it was time to warm up, we popped into a cafe for a bit. I would highly recommend a restaurant called Le Coupe Chew for dinner. FANTASTIC food and ambiance. Not too far from the hotel either. I found that the restaurants serving fondue around the corner from the hotel weren't that good. Besides the fact that they had people standing out front "hooking" you to come in and eat, the food was pretty basic. I felt like I was walking through the red light district and that I'd get a lap dance, too. Perhaps my husband would have liked that :-) I would also recommend taking a pass on the chestnuts roasting on an open fire sold by vendors along the walkways. Unless I got a bad batch, these are just horrid to eat. You've been warned. When you walk, pay attention to where you step. The folks in Paris seem to think that it is okay to allow their pets to deficate on the sidewalk and leave it for an unsuspecting passer by. Stay alert :-) Although, I truly did enjoy drinking my espresso's, cappucino's and latte's in the cafe it was nice to stumble upon Starbucks. It was a smoke free location where I could get a small taste of home. The people working there were really nice, too. All in all, this hotel, the staff, and the location were just great. By the end of the trip, we were finally able to say our hotel number in French without the young lady working the front desk laughing at us. Book your stay now. I don't think that you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but slightly disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Love Travelliing
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here overall, but going by the previous reviews were hoping for something a little better. The reception area was undergoing total renovation at the time which didn't help (disruption, noise etc) but even allowing for that, the hotel had a slightly sad air to it - somewhat cramped and dull. The basement breakfast room was however very pleasant (but 10 euros seemed a little steep) and the staff and service overall couldn't be faulted. Our bathrooms seemed to be brand new so no problem there, and the location was first rate. I think it may be just that 3* hotels in Paris are a bit hit and miss and it depends on your expectations. Having said all that, we would stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Tout Good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a nice place! Staff, room, and service are all great. First time in Paris, we wanted to be on the outer edge of the Latin Quarter, this was a great location. Pretty area; we came out of the metro and into the open air market for added culture shock. The rooms were clean and pleasant, quiet and comfortable. Bathroom was quite nice, the room had a window. There was AC we didn't use. We were in a Double room which seemed plenty big for us. Walls not totally soundproof, but it was quiet. The front desk staff was very helpful and spoke excellent English, open 24 hours. Reservation worked with emailed inquiry then faxed cc #, also they are on laterooms, etc. Highly recommend the off-season! It was cheap and the mood in Paris seemed quite cheerful, with a hint of holiday spirit in the air. The bakeries all had special gallettes to celebrate Epiphany. We had a light dust of snow the first night. Near dawn (jet lag helps sometimes) the first day we were at Erik Kayser around the corner, fresh warm bread kept us warm while we walked to the Louvre. Got there 15 minutes before open and no line. At night, there were people on the street, and we had some fine meals with great Parisian atmosphere: La Boussole, Le Volant, Le Reminet. A city-wide sale on clothes started January 11th or so.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an ideal choice for the budget-minded traveler, though we truly didn’t feel as though we were staying in a “budget” hotel. The location, just a block from St. Germain, with interesting shopping options and a plethora of cafes, and 5 minutes from Notre Dame, made it the perfect jumping off point for touring Paris for us, first-time visitors to this city. The bedding was comfortable, the temperature controls were excellent, and rooms were tidy and well-maintained during our stay. The bathroom was impeccable and an unexpected surprise – very modern in such an older-style building. Would suggest the breakfast if you are in a hurry, or don’t feel like venturing along St. Germain for another option. While the food was good and the coffee was delicious and piping-hot (and since you pay anyway), there are so many other options offered just blocks away – and you aren’t stuck in a basement without the activity of Paris “café-life”. Two experiences that will ensure our return to this charming hotel I’d like to share with my fellow travelers: -We were here on Christmas morning, which was our first morning in Paris and we were admittedly a bit starry-eyed with awe and anxious excitement. Just wanted to grab a cup of coffee from the breakfast room, and when I ran downstairs to inquire, the wonderful woman watching over the area offered a tray, a large pot and all accoutrements. It was a lovely gesture, and very appreciated. [Perhaps I am mistaken, and I somehow missed that they offer room-service, but I don’t believe this was an option and I so appreciated her making me feel like I was treating my mom like a queen on Christmas morning!] -Realizing we still had some postcards from our previous journey in London, and that they were already bearing UK stamps (not friendly to French post, or so I was told) – the front office staff took personal interest and offered to help find another guest traveling to or through England to mail them. Much to my surprise and delight, all 6 of the postcards have already reached their intended recipients! Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Agora - Most Professional in Paris”
Reviews.Content: As an experienced traveller to Paris, the Hotel Agora is without a doubt the most enjoyable place I have stayed. The rooms are spacious and with a beautiful view of Rue Bernardains. With bakeries around the corner and Notre Dame 10 minutes away, the hotel is situated perfectly for the experienced or novice traveler. Especially true is the service the hotel provides. Aline, the receptionist is without a doubt the most helpful and knowlegeable employee at the hotel. She has helped me find restaurants, places to visit and has made my stay seem like I was a member of her family. Her professional knowledge and superb understanding of my needs made a large contribution to my Parisian experience. Without any doubt, I would recommend the Agora and have done so to my friends in the United States. With spotless bathrooms, a beautiful breakfast area and a staff of professionals, Paris and Hotel Agora has become my preferred hotel in France.

Reviews.Title: “The Most Friendly Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After staying several nights at Hotel Agora, I can say without hesitation, "I was home" The comfort of the rooms to the outstanding staff especially at the front desk made my Parisian experience come to life! Especially sincere, helpful and knowledgeable, the young woman at the front desk helped guide me to the best restaurants, easiest routes to museums and gave me the sense, I was her primary customer. I always recommend the Agora to my friends who are travelling to Paris. Without a doubt, the location, staff and comfort rate 5 stars for a 3 star price.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel not very responsive with email confirmations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from stay in Europe (London/Paris). We stayed at this hotal Nov 21-26, 2005. We booked this hotel through American Express Travel, the same as with our London Hotel. Before leaving for our trip, I decided to contact the hotel via email to confirm our room reservations for both hotels. The hotel in London, had a toll free number so I called and confirmed my reservation. The Hotel Agora St. Germain did not so I decided to email the hotel directly. Well, needless to say, I did not receive a reply back before leaving. I was a little concerned but since the hotel in London saw my reservation made through Amex, my husband just said don't worry about it and we went off on our trip. When we arrived at the hotel and en route to the hotel on the chunnel I was thinking about the reservation. Well, guess what.... they didn't have our reservation. Not their fault, in all fairness, it was travelocity whom sold the rooms to Amex... Amex thought everything was confirmed and passed the information to us. So, we felt confident about the choice but we were wrong. The woman at the checkin counter gave us a room anyway but said she wasn't sure if we could stay there the entire trip.... and we would have to take care of it with American Express. Lucky for me I had taken my cell phone and was able to contact American Express. Althought the call cost me .99 cents a minute, it was well worth it since they faxed over the confirmation and called the hotel directly to confirm receipt. This was taken care of within the hour of our arrival. However, starting out like this didn't really leave a good feeling... especially since the lady kept telling us that now she has a problem with people checking in on the 24th Nov. and seemed very frustrated that this happened on her watch. That didn't make things better... to be honest it added to my frustration. My husband had to calm me down of course and reason with me not to lose my temper since it was not really her fault. However, I did email them directly and at a minimum would have expected an reply email with .. "we don't have a reservation for you... etc." I mean they did have a PC with internet access at the front desk. My husband did notice there was a fax on the floor. It is very possible that their carelessness could have caused this confusion and inconvenience. As for the room.... we stayed in room 69. The room was facing the street on 6th floor with a little balcony.. too little to step out but could open window/door and peek out. Heard very little noise. The bathroom was very clean when we arrived and the daily maintenance of same was pretty good. The bed was comfortable. They have a desk with a chair and a small ottoman. Heating in the room was fantastic. lighting was proper. The closet could have been in a different location.. Although the closet was big enough for Paris standards, to get to it and access clothing was a bit tight since it was right next to one of the nightstands... The luggage was easily stored under the closet... unless of course you have monster luggage. We like to travel light so our standard carry-ons fit fine. The room had a very delightful and clean aroma after it was cleaned daily. Oh... and great hot water and water pressure. What I didn't like was that they didn't provide you with shampoo soap and conditioner as separate items. They had a dispenser by the sink and in the shower stall with their so-called combination soap/shampoo/conditioner which really stunk if you asked me. We used it as soap since we had brought our own shampoo. No shower cap, no sewing kit, no other perks except for lotion. They have a mini fridge in the room with refreshments and a beer bottle opener and they do have corkscrews at the front desk you can borrow if you buy some wine. The rest of the staff was very friendly and helpful. All in all is what we expected.... small, clean, tastefully decorated room. My husband just fell in love with the bathroom so I'll give them kudos for that. If it wasn't for that reservation snafu and the front desk person's indifference maybe our rating would have been better. Remember, confirm your reservation by phone with hotel directly. Faxes may end up on the floor below one of their counters/furniture. Oh and don't bother with the Breafast... There are plenty places you can buy a coffee and a croisant for under 4 Euros nearby or do as the parisians do... get a crepe to go... Cheers..and buon voyage

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Agora St. Germain”
Reviews.Author: A-van-the-man
Reviews.Content: I stayed here, when I was in town for business. I’ve been to Paris often, but this is one of the better hotels for a reasonable price. We arrived late at night, but there was a night watch at the reception, which let us in without any problems. The rooms were small, like in every hotel in Paris, but they weren’t too small. The interior was fine, the beds were excellent. More importantly the rooms were clean and were cleaned every day. With fresh towels and new sheets. The bathroom was fine as well, with a good warm, powerful shower in it. Breakfast was excellent, typically French breakfast with fresh bread and cheese. The location of the hotel is excellent, right in the center of the Latin Quarter, with many nice restaurants and cafés nearby. Also the subway is right around the corner, as is the Notre Dame. I would definitely come back to this hotel, either for business or with my girlfriend for a nice weekend in Paris. I can recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JonnyS
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with this charming hotel. Location was great. Staff was very courteous, helpful and accomodating. I will defininitely go back and in fact, my girlfriend and I want to make it a tradition. The room was small by American standards, but for Paris it was perfect. It overlooked a small road that was not too busy. All types of shops were very close and there was a charming church with regular bells to listen to. The place was newly renovated so everthing was clean, functional and nice. There was not a lot of storage space for clothes, but for a 3 star hotel, it was just great!

Reviews.Title: “Not so great”
Reviews.Author: assetlady
Reviews.Content: WE stayed at the Agora hotel for 2 nights then found another hotel which was 15 euors less and much nicer. The Agora rooms were shabby and a very small bathroom and room and the AC did not work. It was a nice location and the staff was very helpful but the hotel is not worth what they charge, there are many hotels in the area much nicer. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent a week there. The location was great. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was nice. The bed was comfortable. The bathroom was beautiful. We booked through Expedia and got breakfast with the price of the room. We had a room at the front of the hotel with French windows overlooking the street with a really fun view of the neighborhood. There was a little street noise during the day, but we enjoyed it ! The nights were peaceful and quiet. Sound proofing was really good if you closed the window. Great bakery around the corner. Would stay again.

HotelInfo.Name: Agora Saint Germain
HotelInfo.Address: 42, rue des Bernardins | 5th Arr., 75005 Paris, France
